rec12dbO0gVYoXVo8.title: Aristocrat
rec12dbO0gVYoXVo8.desc: You were born into nobility and still retain some of its advantages.

rec1a68N4N7uVt3b0.title: Human (Tarkian)
rec1a68N4N7uVt3b0.desc:
A land of vast deserts, arid mountains, and tranquil oases, Tark has long been a problematic yet prosperous province of the Empire. Its people, the Tarkians are a divided lot - city dwellers typically support Imperial rule, having adapted to a profitable symbiosis, while most desert tribes detest what they see as an occupation force. Tarkian culture is exotic to Imperial eyes, and its many unique products have permeated the Empire throughout the centuries but this is not true the other way round. Originating from desert nomads, Tarkians are great at navigating and surviving arid wastelands and are all said to be merchants at heart. Sometimes this means they have a suspicious or unsavory reputation elsewhere.

Tarkians have dusky skin and dark hair.

rec242bden42oBHXr.title: Freeplay
rec242bden42oBHXr.desc:
No victory condition. You can play freely for as long as you desire.

/You can only win the game if you change your Ambition later through options in a story. If you do so, you will still have to achieve that goal no later than 10 in-game years after the game's start./

rec2IIbQpmegWwTw1.title: Human (Dajmahan)
rec2IIbQpmegWwTw1.desc:
Dajmaha, the Land of Endless Rain occupies the northeastern peninsula of the continent of Xeryn, cut off from most other regions by vast mountain ranges and dense jungles. Its people, the Dajmahans, are the descendants of ancient Zenrak, having lived mostly in fractured tribal communities since that old empire’s fall. Dajmaha was miraculously spared from the Calamity, yet magical anomalies and mutants did enter its boundaries afterwards. Several centuries ago, a clan of Dajmahan sorceresses rose to rule the land from three city states on the coast. The Empire has made several attempts to colonize Dajmaha but it has proved impossible as of yet. Dajmahans are often athletic and possess incredible stamina but are considered savages by others.

Dajmahans are dark skinned and dark haired.

rec2zWrPMDmDx342W.title: Orc
rec2zWrPMDmDx342W.desc:
Having been summoned as roaming souls from the Outer Realms and given bodies in a ritual of unmatched sorcerous power, Orcs were created as the perfect warriors without memories: weapons of the Empire in their war on the northern continent about 350 years before present day. However, the Orcs soon found out about the deceit of their masters and rebelled against them. Following a brutal war that nearly collapsed the Empire and made Orcs nigh-extinct, a tenuous status quo was reached in the end, and the surviving Orcs relocated to the swamplands of Darkmoor at the edge of the Empire. Living in tribal societies there ever since, Orcs have become a thorn in the side of everyone, raiding, marauding, and engaging in piracy ceaselessly. Their spirit faith is propagated by shamans and meshes surprisingly well with Orcish warrior culture. Many Orcs find work as mercenaries, bodyguards, and gladiators throughout the Empire, though fear and suspicion surrounds them.

Orcs are muscular, athletic, sturdy, and possess amazing stamina. They are human-sized, with black hair and skin that ranges in color from green to brownish.

rec3wlhgI4Hpc3NQG.title: Veteran
rec3wlhgI4Hpc3NQG.desc: You used to serve in a military force, fighting for a cause or for coin.

rec4cgUHjrbhiA60p.title: Savage
rec4cgUHjrbhiA60p.desc: You lived in a tribal society and know how to survive in the wilderness.

rec5WWC7T62bRR2QY.title: Trader
rec5WWC7T62bRR2QY.desc: You are a traveling merchant, a nomadic trader interested in transporting goods, news, and people to the faraway reaches of the Empire for profit.

rec9vRuOsx0MUkpNU.title: Half-Elf
rec9vRuOsx0MUkpNU.desc:
Not all Dor Anthelas Elves took their own lives after the Calamity or became embittered to the point of insanity. Some of them wandered out into the world and lived out their remaining years among the mortals who survived. These Elves mingled with humans and their progeny are known as the Pereldin, the Half-Elves. Most of them retain the pointed ears, magnificent sight, and light-footedness of their Elven parent as well as the adaptability of their human one. They do not have a culture or realm of their own and typically live their lives on the road or among other folk. Most Gwaeth Elves consider them abominations and most humans think of them as Elves, treacherous and furtive, so they do not trust them.

Half-Elves are tall and lean, with a mostly Elvish appearance yet also some human traits.

recAvCLJzLYPntc6M.title: Mercenary
recAvCLJzLYPntc6M.desc:
You are the captain of a mercenary company that seeks to work dangerous jobs, hunt bounties, or even raid camps and settlements out in the wasteland.

/This Calling is geared towards armed conflicts and starts with a larger fighting crew, which results in higher upkeep. Therefore, we only recommend choosing Mercenary for more experienced players./

recAxkiULIyTSWaSe.title: Entertainer
recAxkiULIyTSWaSe.desc: You used to make a living entertaining people.

recCtpTFeKvD9JuDY.title: Healer
recCtpTFeKvD9JuDY.desc: You studied and practiced the art of healing.

recD1c05rV3yg0jpt.title: Criminal - Loaders
recD1c05rV3yg0jpt.desc: Your past involved criminal activities and you still have connections to the Loaders' Guild.

recDiWpyYucDYypSB.title: Dwarf
recDiWpyYucDYypSB.desc:
The mighty Dwarven kingdom of Dvendar Tharr was the greatest ally of the Empire before the Calamity, and gifted humans most secrets of metal and stone. Dwarven technology was a true marvel, and the line of Inventor Kings governed the kingdom into a golden age of progress. When the Calamity struck, most of Dvendar Tharr was cursed and destroyed in a conflagration of fire and lava as the great mountains that they were built upon and into erupted. The several thousand survivors of the cataclysm became a wandering people, at the same time coveting and hating the technology that they think led to their downfall. Their former merry and progressive nature turned into bitterness, pragmatism, and cynicism. For all intents and purposes, Dwarves are a dying race.

Stocky and sturdy, Dwarves are a hardy folk. Men almost always grow beards.

recEtC7M9Rxmym0Mp.title: Criminal - Carpenters
recEtC7M9Rxmym0Mp.desc: Your past involved criminal activities and you still have connections to the Carpenters' Guild.

recKMdqX3oUqRbPDn.title: Renown
recKMdqX3oUqRbPDn.desc:
Your goal is to become well-known and respected in society, one of the most famous /vagri/ ever to travel the far reaches of the Empire.

/Choose this Ambition if you want to focus more on completing difficult quests and working towards unlocking a higher standing for a number of Factions. Continuously securing funds to be able to do these is still required. You have around 10 in-game years to complete this goal./

recLysm09CjUocsDx.title: Explorer
recLysm09CjUocsDx.desc:
You are a seeker of knowledge and new places, someone who delves into ancient ruins and dangerous locations to find treasures, artifacts, and old secrets.

/This Calling is geared towards surviving in the wilderness and starts with a larger specialized crew, which results in higher upkeep. Therefore, we only recommend choosing Explorer for more experienced players./

recNKruNU5AcowfFs.title: Adventurer
recNKruNU5AcowfFs.desc: You used to travel a lot and sought adventure everywhere.

recSCwhNrb0PrLmDS.title: Slaver
recSCwhNrb0PrLmDS.desc: You were a professional slave catcher and slave trader.

recT2tFPZNDB08udA.title: Artisan
recT2tFPZNDB08udA.desc: You used to craft goods and sell them for a living.

recTDS9WrhxvAX6R9.title: Ranger
recTDS9WrhxvAX6R9.desc: You learned how to live and survive in the wastelands of the continent.

recTv6GudMYM0fyVH.title: Human (Kalani)
recTv6GudMYM0fyVH.desc:
The Kalani people of the east originate from coastal clans who survived the fall of Kimora. Their progressive and wealthy realm joined the Empire in the Golden Age and contributed considerably to the rise of Imperial society and culture. The Calamity struck and vastly changed the face of the eastern regions, erasing Kalani cities and burning the wonderful forests into formations of glass and crystal. The people survived as three separate clans and rejoined the Empire when it reemerged. Crystal is everywhere in Sargot Kala, the richest and most important of the three regions, so crystal harvesting, crystal growing, and Crystalmancy has become the major occupation in the region. Kalani are considered good mediators and a stoic, strong-willed people.

Kalani are usually dark haired and fair skinned with blue or green eyes.

recb2bjhA4nFlvVN0.title: Demonkin
recb2bjhA4nFlvVN0.desc:
Demonkin is a general name for the many beings that have Demonic blood in their veins but it is more specifically used for those who have Demonic ancestry in their grandparents or farther back. The heritage manifests as an aura of uneasiness that surrounds the Demonkin, as well as in physical - and sometimes sorcerous - traits borne by the person. Each type of Demon produces a set of traits in its Demonkin typical to its own form and abilities. Demonkin came to be fairly common on the continent after the Calamity, as the cataclysm broke the barriers between the Outer Realms and Xeryn, allowing denizens of the Abyss to enter and thrive in the Riven Realms, and to mingle with its mortal inhabitants. Demonkin do not have a culture or realm of their own but live among other races, most frequently humans.

Demonkin look fairly human but retain some physical aspects of their Outer Realms ancestors - most commonly horns, fangs, claws, as well as unusual skin and eye color.

recekjve6r8t8AsEz.title: Priest - Imperial
recekjve6r8t8AsEz.desc: You used to study and practice Imperial religious dogma.

recemrNyKrCgBjmLs.title: Scholar
recemrNyKrCgBjmLs.desc: You studied a great many subjects and are considered wise.

recfuyecoF2JmLSwr.title: Wealth
recfuyecoF2JmLSwr.desc:
Your goal is to amass a great amount of wealth so that you don’t have to worry about the future ever again.

/Choose this Ambition if you want to focus on trading, resource management, and the economy aspects of the game without having to get into quests and stories. You have around 10 in-game years to complete this goal./

recqRnnqqQ5Tb9AXN.title: Knowledge
recqRnnqqQ5Tb9AXN.desc:
Your goal is to learn everything there is to learn about the continent and its inhabitants, as well as to find a way to preserve it for posterity.

/Choose this Ambition if you want to focus on hunting for obscure Codex entries as well as delving into dangerous locations. Continuously securing funds to be able to do these is still required. You have around 10 in-game years to complete this goal./

recsZVsHxy9TLdGyb.title: Dark Elf
recsZVsHxy9TLdGyb.desc:
According to legend, the race today called Moreldin were once Elves, but their ancestors were cast out and exiled after massacring their own kind during a series of tragic events. Shunned and stripped of their immortality, this progenitor clan sought refuge underground and found solace in the perpetual darkness and the embrace of Demonic worship. They hate light and the sun that burned their eyes and revealed them for what they truly were. In the next several thousand years, they conquered the deep places, built their underground great cities, and became a power to be reckoned with. After the Calamity, many of them relocated below Xeryn from their northern realms as it seemed to be both a new frontier and a place that became more hospitable to their needs. Loosely allied with the Empire, many Dark Elves are known to worship Demons, among whom Bal Ur Kaal is chief.

Dark Elves look like Elves, but are shorter, with dark grey skin and pale blue eyes. Their hair is white, grey, or silver.

recwHIjJt1NytYYP9.title: Sorcerer's Apprentice
recwHIjJt1NytYYP9.desc: You used to study sorcery briefly and still retain some knowledge of it.

recwq8WSY4U6226H7.title: Human (Imperial)
recwq8WSY4U6226H7.desc:
Imperials are an industrious and generally cultured people, tracing their origins back to the ancient humans of Daromar who migrated south and settled in the land of Aetruas. The Empire managed to survive the Calamity, albeit at great cost, and remains one of the greatest powers on the continent of Xeryn. At its peak, few - if any - realms could match its prosperity, knowledge, and power, though this came at the cost of slavery and the oppression of other nations. Imperials in the Fourth Age are usually proud of such a past, though it is sometimes fused with a sense of bitterness. Business and progress are also close to the Imperial spirit and the heritage of building a great society still lingers in the post-Calamity era.

Imperials are light of skin and often dark of hair, though people of Daromarian heritage tend to be tall and fair haired.

recyhvY4oZo47916d.title: Laborer
recyhvY4oZo47916d.desc: You used to be a manual worker or a slave.

recKPa74oTqLA9jhi.title: Defending The Crew
recKPa74oTqLA9jhi.desc:
Absorbs Damage from attacks trying to capture someone from the Crew
/No protection for Beasts or Cargo/

recQUQbVQYrnucDLo.title: Protecting Armed Crew
recQUQbVQYrnucDLo.desc:
Fends off Damage from attacks made against the Fighting Crew.
/No protection for Beasts, Cargo or Crew/

receNoDsWky3xhOv7.title: Defending The Cargo
receNoDsWky3xhOv7.desc:
Absorbs Damage from attacks trying to grab goods from the Cargo
/No protection for Beasts or Crew/

reciE4qAEIvLJ2Gsp.title: Defending Equally
reciE4qAEIvLJ2Gsp.desc: Balances Absorbing Damage made against Beasts, Cargo, and Crew

recl9BxYioeONTzHf.title: Defending The Beasts
recl9BxYioeONTzHf.desc:
Absorbs Damage from attacks trying to capture Beasts
/No protection for Cargo or Crew/

recuUgfy7PXSLHDyv.title: Voracious
recuUgfy7PXSLHDyv.desc: Targets Supplies, Mounts and Beasts of Burden

rec2dJCOqj3oOspsr.title: Shield Wall
rec2dJCOqj3oOspsr.desc: Your fighters form a shield wall, raising their defensive capabilities.

recCkqrH9YudKFeE5.title: Waylay
recCkqrH9YudKFeE5.desc: Decimate the advancing enemy with traps and surprise attacks.

recG9UAN53jN70kUb.title: Advanced Wedge
recG9UAN53jN70kUb.desc: Attack in an advanced offensive formation.

recJxaJI0OsqGu5Iz.title: Cavalry Charge
recJxaJI0OsqGu5Iz.desc: Devastating cavalry charges that make use of outriders.

recKG6X4Ul69dHqq5.title: Eliminate Leaders
recKG6X4Ul69dHqq5.desc: Take out their leaders with your best

recL7QzP64CnpXCvW.title: Demoralize
recL7QzP64CnpXCvW.desc: Underhanded tactics take the fight out of the enemy and invigorate your crew.

recOR7ZUNG7ZcuU4Z.title: Flank
recOR7ZUNG7ZcuU4Z.desc: A contingent of your fighters tries to outflank the enemy.

recOVYfrdeKEG1slA.title: Cull Their Ranks
recOVYfrdeKEG1slA.desc: Cull their ranks with your best

recRK6QFqcmiHlsid.title: Guarded Assault
recRK6QFqcmiHlsid.desc: Advanced attack maneuver with lower cost in offensive capability.

recSttcvVCGVvo3EO.title: Flanking Assault
recSttcvVCGVvo3EO.desc: Advanced flanking tactics that can cause massive damage.

recVX8b0jqLUPOqZY.title: Reconnaisance
recVX8b0jqLUPOqZY.desc: Spy on the enemy in preparation for your attack.

recWQ4uMKWZVsySLo.title: Feint
recWQ4uMKWZVsySLo.desc: A deceptive advance that seeks to hide your real attack.

recWthS3zpcglEsLj.title: Concentrated Defense
recWthS3zpcglEsLj.desc: Your fighting crew defends at the place of your choosing at all costs.

recb5hXDDxvQngXWQ.title: Insult
recb5hXDDxvQngXWQ.desc: Choice curses and insults cause the enemy to lose integrity and make mistakes.

reccl4AsCBoOoYSWC.title: Barricades
reccl4AsCBoOoYSWC.desc: Defensive structures to protect against enemy advances.

receALS50CNqybi5u.title: Intercept
receALS50CNqybi5u.desc: Your outrider force prevents the enemy from fleeing.

receDyTCYeocVflNs.title: Guarded Advance
receDyTCYeocVflNs.desc: A careful attack maneuver that sacrifices offense in order to keep your fighters safe.

recfAt2tB59ZDnR72.title: Charge
recfAt2tB59ZDnR72.desc: Rush the enemy with all you have. Risky but can be very effective.

recjM1MHCZmfL6Shv.title: Makeshift Barricade
recjM1MHCZmfL6Shv.desc: Improvise defensive structures to protect against enemy advances.

recmG5IkpK9FE0U5M.title: Skirmish
recmG5IkpK9FE0U5M.desc: Use your scouts to harass the enemy and catch stragglers.

recmz87CyK7uATNOi.title: Counter-attack
recmz87CyK7uATNOi.desc: Strike back at the enemy after repelling their advance.

recnJR8wKrkljxxMt.title: Hit and Run Tactics
recnJR8wKrkljxxMt.desc: Use your scouts to weaken the enemy and eliminate stragglers.

recngLWKra514YOy4.title: Mounted Charge
recngLWKra514YOy4.desc: Your outriders sweep the enemy from the sides while your fighters keep them at bay.

recpGD82Z0CuhCTk2.title: Wedge Formation
recpGD82Z0CuhCTk2.desc: Attack in an offensive formation, sacrificing defense.

recqIfGfzfTd0eKrl.title: Bushwhack
recqIfGfzfTd0eKrl.desc: Ambush the advancing enemy with traps and surprise attacks.

recuRzODln81bOjYu.title: Hold Them Off
recuRzODln81bOjYu.desc: Hold them off with your best

recySNh2ubOiDJWuk.title: Testudo
recySNh2ubOiDJWuk.desc: Advanced shield wall formation, raising defensive capabilities.

rec1DHlXT74goCXpM.title: Executor of Sergorod
rec1DHlXT74goCXpM.desc: A member of the militant Order of Executors, a notorious sect of the Church of Sergorod. They serve as the elite police force of the Church. This man serves Sedarias unquestioningly.

rec2ot5Asw7c0Wjo1.title: Criftaa
rec2ot5Asw7c0Wjo1.desc: A merciless bounty hunter and slave catcher, Criftaa has earned herself a dreadful reputation in recent years. Her dark past is full of violence and surviving what she had made her a very tough customer. That history makes her distrustful and sometimes even cruel. Criftaa is Tainted and although the transformation clearly took a great toll on her mind, it gave her amazing sight and reflexes in turn. She is an excellent shot with the bow and an accomplished huntress on top of that. Whether the target is a beast or a person, Criftaa has little to no qualms and rarely misses her mark.

rec387kUISBEZo7an.title: Renkailon
rec387kUISBEZo7an.desc: Renkailon is a Dark Elf and thus is not a common sight in the sun-drenched northern reaches of the Empire as his kind shuns the light in general. However, through his long life as a wanderer, explorer, and scout-for-hire, Ren has learned how to deal with such inconveniences — and much more. He is a capable fellow, even if somewhat of a coward, preferring to skulk in the background and deal with matters in a subtle way. A veteran of many /comitati/, he has a vast amount of experience coordinating scouts and leading the way. Renkailon is fairly likable and easy-going — for a Dark Elf — but he seems to be harried by something he does not want to disclose.

rec7Bqsvv8jVYpUHN.title: Gor’Goro
rec7Bqsvv8jVYpUHN.desc: Gor’Goro is considered a prodigy among Orcs, especially when his relative youth is taken into account. A warrior of great renown — former gladiator, feared marauder, and drill master — he has already seen more combat than most other fighters do in a lifetime. Yet for some reason, Gor’Goro has not stepped up as a Warleader for his own kin and chose to wander the continent, living as a mercenary instead, unsure about the fate marked out for his people as well as for his own person. Lately a trainer of gladiators and warriors, the young Orc is eager to set out again and explore the continent. With his skills and experience, he can become a great asset to any /comitatus/.

recAzOO3RS1OI6U6G.title: Vorax
recAzOO3RS1OI6U6G.desc: Vorax means “gluttonous” in the Imperial tongue, a name this Undead earned because he keeps devouring food even though his dead innards can no longer digest it. This is something of a mystery rivaling only his reason for returning from the echoing halls of Tartaris. Garrulous and jovial, Vorax recalls nothing from his former life except for his cooking skills. That — coupled with his obsession with food, as well as his exceptionally sharp mind — makes him a great quartermaster. He seems to be solely interested in campfire stories and good eating but some believe that terrible secrets are hiding beneath all that geniality. Vorax pays little mind to them, however, only wishing to please.

recMuEpzE6eYXCK0Y.title: Eylani
recMuEpzE6eYXCK0Y.desc: The free-spirited beastmaster has wandered the wastelands of terra supra for decades now, living off of hunting. She enters the employment of /vagri/ or other influential people from time to time, but when the notorious wanderlust of Half-Elves overtakes her, she is known to leave and walk her path alone. Rumor has it that she sometimes shares these journeys with someone close to her. Eylani is a skilled warrior, scout, huntress, and tracker, but her greatest asset is her unique ability to communicate with animals, which makes her one of the best beast handlers in the Realms. Just be careful not to hurt animals unless absolutely necessary, as that is something she cannot abide.

recNgchf1uPAD7X8K.title: Skornar
recNgchf1uPAD7X8K.desc: The former kingpin and veteran warrior Skornar, called “The Blue-faced”, does not hail from Xeryn but from the green continent in the north. Generally, this would mean capture and persecution, yet the fierce marauder not only avoided this fate but managed to build a life and business for himself in the Riven Realms. Fearless and clever, he was respected by all, but even still, ambitious young blood saw the time to remove the aging mob boss eventually. Skornar is not someone to be easily disposed of, however, and having survived the ordeal, he is eager to pay treachery back in kind. Many would underestimate him due to his age but he still wields his shield and axe with deadly proficiency.

recOd58mobAH0zfvf.title: Priest of Sergorod
recOd58mobAH0zfvf.desc: A priest of the Church of Sergorod, God of Vengeance and Curses. They work in versatile roles across the Empire, most often as judges and executioners. This man serves Sedarias unquestioningly.

recQNRuGWAUw1WlY7.title: Finndurarth
recQNRuGWAUw1WlY7.desc: Finndurarth is a Dragonkin from the brood of the Blue Dragonlord. Ever since she was a child, she has been told that she is destined for greatness, which perfectly explains her sense of entitlement and self-righteousness. Yet when presented with opportunities at the Hall of Voices on a silver platter, she rather chose the dangerous position of diplomatic attaché to foreign lands, wishing to prove that she can do well without her family’s influence. As a pureblood Dragonmage, she can wreak havoc using lightning-based magic and protect the /comitatus/ from arcane threats. Finndurarth is educated in a number of scholarly topics as well, and her charisma is undeniable.

recbLlSHJqCbRBspx.title: Gor’Goro
recbLlSHJqCbRBspx.desc: Gor’Goro is considered a prodigy among Orcs, especially when his relative youth is taken into account. A warrior of great renown — former gladiator, feared marauder, and drill master — he has already seen more combat than most other fighters do in a lifetime. Yet for some reason, Gor’Goro has not stepped up as a Warleader for his own kin and chose to wander the continent, living as a mercenary instead, unsure about the fate marked out for his people as well as for his own person. Lately a trainer of gladiators and warriors, the young Orc is eager to set out again and explore the continent. With his skills and experience, he can become a great asset to any /comitatus/.

recbQNPNaK2LaLDtc.title: Harvek
recbQNPNaK2LaLDtc.desc: The sinister-looking Harvek is a true survivor and a warrior for hire with strong connections to organized crime. After getting involved with /collegia/ at a young age, he was eventually arrested and taken to Purgatoria, considered to be the cruelest prison on the continent. Inmates do not usually make it to their one year anniversary there but Harvek survived for twelve whole years, largely thanks to his transformation due to the Taint, which gave him mutations he learned to use as lethal tools. He was eventually released and now started looking for work. Harvek is usually calm and professional, yet he has something menacing about him, a cruelty that comes natural to the Tainted mercenary.

reccwHK6CZzPmxclL.title: Nedir
reccwHK6CZzPmxclL.desc: Nedir used to study in the Crimson Order, the continent’s most powerful and influential covenant of mages. However, her curiosity regarding the darker arts and her no-nonsense attitude led to her leaving the Order, and she ended up wandering the Realms. Yet, this has not quenched her thirst for magical knowledge and Nedir taught herself a lot in the past years, becoming adept at forms of pyromancy, blood magic, mind-altering spells, and even the summoning of Demonic beings. Her confidence and sharpness of mind has made her a formidable individual but there is a darkness in her, feeding on ambition and arrogance, as likely to damn the sorceress as it is to propel her to greatness.

recdlxUA6jJuT3jAn.title: Garrik
recdlxUA6jJuT3jAn.desc: The Dwarf called Garrik is well-known in the criminal underworld of the central regions. His reputation as a nasty, mean, and malevolent creature is well-deserved, though these traits are generally attributed to Dwarves anyway. Garrik is disinterested in delving into the ruins of his fallen nation — he has built himself a smuggling business instead, which has seen him grow wealthy and influential. That is, until he lost everything due to some ill-fated ventures and loans. Garrik is not one to give up easily though, something perhaps stemming from Dwarvish stubbornness. He is an accomplished businessman and he always has something up his sleeve when it comes to fights.

recfr31baUhnniQFa.title: Sedarias
recfr31baUhnniQFa.desc: An anointed knight of the Order of the Black Sun, Sedarias is a formidable man of noble birth in his early thirties. He is arrogant and self-absorbed, which no doubt stems from both an upbringing in privilege and the rigorous training he endured as a squire of the Order. In his eyes, this schooling has made him impeccable when pursuing retribution, something he does not take lightly. Wearing the signature black iron armor of his knightly order and wielding a greatsword as well as the unholy powers of his Gods, he is a force to be reckoned with. You saved his life, yet you’ve been press-ganged into helping him ever since.

recjJ0jIPl4e6aI81.title: Javek
recjJ0jIPl4e6aI81.desc: Javek has been your friend for a while, having joined your comitatus after your previous chief handler fell victim to an anomaly a few years ago. He quickly earned your trust thanks to his good nature, his easy-going attitude as well as to his sorcerous abilities that involve scanning surface thoughts, dominating the minds of beasts, and even seeing glimpses of the near future. Javek is of Tarkian origin, and though he seldom speaks of this past, you have learned that he used to be a slave before he was liberated by a /vagrus/. His skills - both mundane and arcane - have proved to be invaluable to you in years past.

recsvLkljfX4JmzvE.title: Renkailon
recsvLkljfX4JmzvE.desc: Renkailon is a Dark Elf and thus is not a common sight in the sun-drenched northern reaches of the Empire as his kind shuns the light in general. However, through his long life as a wanderer, explorer, and scout-for-hire, Ren has learned how to deal with such inconveniences — and much more. He is a capable fellow, even if somewhat of a coward, preferring to skulk in the background and deal with matters in a subtle way. A veteran of many /comitati/, he has a vast amount of experience coordinating scouts and leading the way. Renkailon is fairly likable and easy-going — for a Dark Elf — but he seems to be harried by something he does not want to disclose.

recwzF7ddPAMPsFhh.title: Morwen
recwzF7ddPAMPsFhh.desc: Due to a reputation of being a heartless mercenary and a loner, nobody considered Morwen a valuable asset to a /comitatus/ such as yours. Yet you saw something in her and offered her a job years ago. She accepted and you have never regretted it ever since. A deft scout and a skillful warrior, she has proven her mettle more times than you could recall. She is very quiet and reticent, which is in stark contrast with the aura of uneasiness that surrounds members of her race, the Demonkin. You don’t mind that either though, as she mostly keeps to herself.

rec9JhaiVm6ASUSWX.title: Terrifying

rec9RepPwA9nnUOEs.title: Beastmaster

rec9X86uXds34pBKV.title: Slavedriver

recAS1bDWXVKnvR6z.title: Marksman

recBIq29Hkwj6fDvA.title: Bouncer

recBR7IDG9ja77IdB.title: Survival

recBzY0GOYYce91ng.title: Scout Master

recE4aZCfknQzMjN3.title: Deft Swordsman
recE4aZCfknQzMjN3.desc: Renkailon is an agile master of the short blade when having to rely on it.

recEaJySuTCCLES1B.title: Dilettante Sorcerer

recEkPjzQ3UakZ2aw.title: Ranger

recEwgo9cLhCyUWpp.title: Wanderlust

recFCIbmoyPjkuYWk.title: Arcane Leech

recFI0WfPlQqTPdsg.title: Sorceress

recGRZzmZso0oy44b.title: Stout
recGRZzmZso0oy44b.desc: She never backed down, never faltered when her beloved beasts were in danger.

recGjm51Xu0sqPwuE.title: Guard Captain

recHMo0COX7qsFqYW.title: Aid

recHNmE0VGvhPM3TG.title: Tiny

recJdFruThdHhtd1X.title: Impervious

recKgWdVmwDb6IcXj.title: Traverse

recLLfoKAyIkezzfp.title: Life Leech

recLg7txCuEyYkv5L.title: Ambitious

recLnryS33Ho2N1wb.title: Diehard

recLpTi4uox9qUNQ9.title: Engineering

recLuZgMUcPsxrkms.title: Craven

recMDkgYvX1SuLTkA.title: Defender

recMKueqttGjAXWRf.title: Survivor

recNS8Ly3HRg2HzRe.title: Pureblood

recNTpmjLsF5jnvbE.title: Hunting

recOyEGyfKbja6kSd.title: Savvy
recOyEGyfKbja6kSd.desc:
The measure of the character's intellect.
/Used in Events (relevant Test chances, requirements) and in Companion progression (for certain Skills)./

recPKVK839QSL89Oc.title: Magic Sense

recPRY1iYJM1YtdtI.title: Acrobatic

recQhKivt0KjPD6ZN.title: Beast Lore

recR0PxIbKA4wlO6y.title: Persuasion

recRMYeIHdoLyAM7R.title: Prodigy

recRtYthUhbWzr4Bh.title: Marauder
recRtYthUhbWzr4Bh.desc: Skornar has never denied a long past of raiding and pillaging that toughened him up considerably.

recSkcJzg0O0YFPVT.title: Doctore

recTFEPjJAhqSMJsD.title: Venatoris
recTFEPjJAhqSMJsD.desc: A master hunter who organizes hunting parties from your scouts. Knowledgeable in beast lore and monsters.

recTrOqirHvQYMZpg.title: Con
recTrOqirHvQYMZpg.desc: You know how to swindle people and lie effectively.

recTxxPPmd3F18jtj.title: Perceptive
recTxxPPmd3F18jtj.desc:
The sharpness of the character's senses and attentiveness.
/Used in Events (relevant Test chances, requirements) and in Companion progression (for certain Skills). No direct effect in combat./

recUWLfrhx4BpAMGV.title: Spellweaver

recWc0ekJDtPMByww.title: History

recXUZomn0sJVHEEw.title: Tenacious

recY0reAsc2ZC9qgA.title: Immovable

recYDHNBj0PUYyddU.title: Arcane Lore
recYDHNBj0PUYyddU.desc: You are learned in the laws, theories, and application of magic.

recYGaOlD0EGYreNc.title: Religion

recZCFNJrh7tTsm5U.title: Marauder Prime

recZRB3pWYyfqExKn.title: Evaluate

recaNM0EK4bXOnaYc.title: Resolute

recaWmPq3epXA23l6.title: Gladiator
recaWmPq3epXA23l6.desc: A champion of countless arenas and fighting pits, Gor'Goro is the paragon of warriors.

recafYx3zTrg7ARBH.title: Draconic Resilience

recay1dJdNmjOm2vu.title: Command

recc1oSzqmvZzS0Gv.title: Spell Penetration
recc1oSzqmvZzS0Gv.desc: Resistances against your magical skills are lowered by 15%.

recdHuGmOEgtHPU4U.title: Dark Pact

recdbB4K8hbh0H3af.title: Wasteland Warrior
recdbB4K8hbh0H3af.desc: What terrible wounds could have turned her into such a ruthless warrior?

recdshfQRScLDr1Pn.title: Chief Handler

receOBco3uZXs2eCO.title: Dimensional Instablity

recepdOSpTiEonKkC.title: Weapons Master

recfDIDLVumfV7XU1.title: Inspire

rech3M7T1aJ4uDtT5.title: Supercargo

reciAZVlsV2qId5sb.title: Kingpin

recibtF1NCvoj16zU.title: Mighty
recibtF1NCvoj16zU.desc:
The measure of the character's physical strength.
/Used in Events (relevant Test chances, requirements) and in Companion progression (for certain Skills). No direct effect in combat./

recjC1pYK65D0V0b2.title: Cunning Huntress

recjEDMNcaxTr6uN1.title: Gadgeteer

reckReMfBXZCGqeHP.title: Charismatic

The character's innate ability to inspire devotion and earn trust.
/Used in Events (relevant Test chances, requirements) and in Companion progression (for certain Skills)./

reckbuBhfIW8hP41Q.title: Elven Blood

reclSv4Jb1fzsdZUB.title: Dexterous

The measure of the character's dexterity and agility.
/Used in Events (relevant Test chances, requirements) and in Companion progression (for certain Skills). No direct effect on combat./

recm9DUAWZpWJL764.title: Gods' Beloved

recneOcTFJKTHInc3.title: Voluble

recqJnIIJz4FRRMRB.title: Exploit

recqYyujdUF65BHDT.title: Smuggler

recqraJXubHlu4Kyn.title: Tough
recqraJXubHlu4Kyn.desc:
The measure of the character's stamina and constitution.
/Used in Events (relevant Test chances, requirements) and in Companion progression (for certain Skills). No direct effect in combat./

recqtXMnYPGeejsMI.title: Chitinous Growths
recqtXMnYPGeejsMI.desc: The Taint can go dormant for decades only to suddenly reemerge and cause further mutations.

recr8O1AvRqbgYm1p.title: Outer Realms Lore

recrRxSdVQXk4KXyj.title: Empower
recrRxSdVQXk4KXyj.desc: You can use Resourcefulness to grant POW to Companions in combat.

recsMpH9c0EsFSpxl.title: Navigation
recsMpH9c0EsFSpxl.desc: You can read and draw maps, as well as orient yourself anywhere.

recspplJUxwKkuVaL.title: Blood Magic

rectRniw0qZnfzguq.title: Bounty Hunter

rectcVWrByCTEnVt9.title: Durable Spells
rectcVWrByCTEnVt9.desc: Your magical skill effects last 1 additional turn.

recuL70nL3lhifB4G.title: Retaliation
recuL70nL3lhifB4G.desc: Upon a successful Block, strike back at attackers in melee range.

recvDHzdcMoAX2GsT.title: Prospecting
recvDHzdcMoAX2GsT.desc: You are skilled in mining, scavenging, and digging things up.

recvlesCeH7fODBtV.title: The Darkness Within
recvlesCeH7fODBtV.desc: There is a darkness growing inside of him, casting a long shadow over heart and mind.

recw8fIpiiE6qgizy.title: Channeling
recw8fIpiiE6qgizy.desc: Skill POW costs are lowered by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

recwdezYjH7b3ia2K.title: Fearless
recwdezYjH7b3ia2K.desc: You are immune to Fear effects.

recypZxeOeq6DCD3v.title: Boost
recypZxeOeq6DCD3v.desc: You can use Resourcefulness to temporarily raise the level of Companion skills in combat.

reczFSg3s8np03cLi.title: Persistent
reczFSg3s8np03cLi.desc: Garrik's tenacity may stem from a hard-headed stubbornness, yet it has saved his skin countless times.

rec1f4czVarGW3RLT.title: Smuggler's Compartments
rec1f4czVarGW3RLT.desc: Containers and bags prepared by smugglers to hide problematic goods in hidden places.

rec37SvXyJ8gzFYiy.title: Mining Equipment

rec3BbuT1z73EzjQs.title: Trader's Backpacks
rec3BbuT1z73EzjQs.desc: Huge, well-balanced backpacks that allow workers to carry more cargo.

rec8ZGAEsJTqI1E18.title: Fire Bombs
rec8ZGAEsJTqI1E18.desc: A Dwarven invention, firebombs are volatile but effective weapons of destruction if you want to ignite things - or people.

rec8vejpQCvfAmqpu.title: Falcons

recAF5fW6pPfrC6jx.title: Hunting Animals

recC9jLWN5xIQNjyi.title: Heat Shielding Crystal
recC9jLWN5xIQNjyi.desc: A special crystal, carved and enchanted exquisitely. A sorcerer can use it to cover the /comitatus/ with a heat-blocking arcane barrier.

recDJXfAoAgz5acds.title: Guard Animals
recDJXfAoAgz5acds.desc: A pack of Mokoru to sniff out danger and alert you.

recE00psMC1z16SIo.title: Good Quality Tools
recE00psMC1z16SIo.desc: Tools crafted of obsidian, ivory, and other good materials. These make the life of your workers easier.

recHULW7KmxoKAk0e.title: Awnings
recHULW7KmxoKAk0e.desc: Linen awnings stretched over saddles and carts to block harmful weather effects and provide shade.

recJ17JWk9x2SxE91.title: Bronze Armaments
recJ17JWk9x2SxE91.desc: Weapons and shields for your fighters, made of bronze.

recKfnQ2pQxDNUJks.title: Spyglass
recKfnQ2pQxDNUJks.desc: A very simple spyglass of Tarkian design. Does not see very far and the image is blurry.

recKzPj9BbyWVcpEF.title: Extended Storage
recKzPj9BbyWVcpEF.desc: Cargo containers are enlarged, allowing much better storage.

recOb0E5I5QSoDLEc.title: Standard Armaments
recOb0E5I5QSoDLEc.desc: Bone and obsidian weapons with hardened leather shields for your fighters.

recOjfLuGG6Ih9NOq.title: Yskaari Larva
recOjfLuGG6Ih9NOq.desc: The odd, dormant larva emits unique thought patterns, which makes it less likely that Yrg attack the /comitatus/ - unless you attack them first.

recOwiLxwlGktodll.title: Tarkian Awnings

recQDdh62Nrt3nxw0.title: Trapping Nets
recQDdh62Nrt3nxw0.desc: These sturdy nets - often used by gladiators and slave hunters - are ideal to catch prey or fleeing enemies.

recQyQL0i2MbFF4iT.title: Map of (Region)
recQyQL0i2MbFF4iT.desc: A map is a real treasure for those who know how to read it.

recRcrhmpKjKe5P0f.title: Sergorod's Blessed Idol
recRcrhmpKjKe5P0f.desc: A great iron idol in the shape of the Raging One, blessed by his unholy priests to fuel the rage of those fighting before it and to curse his enemies.

recSnJx9wG6uEl1TE.title: Protected Harnesses
recSnJx9wG6uEl1TE.desc: Saddles and harnesses are equipped with hardened leather shields to protect animals and riders.

recToSL0XDxTD7hZj.title: Candle of the Living
recToSL0XDxTD7hZj.desc: White candle carved to look like a hooded skeleton and blessed by the priests of Ahskul, God of the Underworld. When lit, undead in the vicinity are less likely to attack.

recV5kLX79WOF4iMD.title: Iron Armaments
recV5kLX79WOF4iMD.desc: Weapons and shields for your fighters, made of iron.

recV9jgrKgFaplprA.title: Lances
recV9jgrKgFaplprA.desc: Iron-tipped light cavalry lances that are quite rare due to the materials required to craft them.

recXuKe7FmFl7pw8T.title: Traveling Saddles
recXuKe7FmFl7pw8T.desc: These hardened leather saddles are not ideal for a fight but make mounted travel much more comfortable.

recZzDJxVMIdSo1GV.title: Shriekers
recZzDJxVMIdSo1GV.desc: A handful of large, docile bugs that emit an eardrum-shattering shriek when disturbed or attacked. When trained, they make an excellent alarm system.

recarJWQnioefBotD.title: Burhek's Traps
recarJWQnioefBotD.desc: Traps prepared by Burhek the hunter. They are surprisingly effective and your own crew can now repair them to be used again and again.

recdKkzbMBWuSzsbg.title: Blinders and Combat Saddles
recdKkzbMBWuSzsbg.desc: These blinders and saddles specialized for mounted combat can give your outriders the edge in any wasteland skirmish.

recdkPXMhYyHGRTh8.title: Yrg Combat Apex Crystal
recdkPXMhYyHGRTh8.desc: An arcane crystal that allows the use of complex mental commands on bound Yrgs drones, making them more formidable in combat.

recfH7HPG5d1mSIY4.title: Calerus Protection Gear
recfH7HPG5d1mSIY4.desc: Dark goggles for your crew and absorbing blankets for your beasts. These will protect your comitatus from going blind in a calerus.

recfx5VFYP7cyaq6Z.title: Scrying Orb
recfx5VFYP7cyaq6Z.desc: A crystal orb that can show distant people, places, and objects in the hands of a sorcerer.

rechcIy1qNQYzclTu.title: Exquisite Banner
rechcIy1qNQYzclTu.desc: A magnificently woven banner; the symbol of any grand leader.

reci60gLRBBSVbBjG.title: Skewers
reci60gLRBBSVbBjG.desc: Bone and obsidian spikes are mounted on beasts' harnesses to deter or skewer attackers.

recjkSRY3ZkxkMvJG.title: Reinforced Cartwheels
recjkSRY3ZkxkMvJG.desc: The wheels of carts are reinforced by iron.

reckLOmHGoGWIo40G.title: Dwarven Compass
reckLOmHGoGWIo40G.desc: A wonder of the ancient world. It points north.

reckt3YQC3HvucQXu.title: Mount Blankets
