Judge, jury, and often executioner, priests of the Raging One wield terrifying power in the Realms.

reclXBoZGM0sdIEzK.title: Loaders' Guild
reclXBoZGM0sdIEzK.desc: One of the large criminal organizations of the Imperial underworld, the Guild grew out of the unionization of hoarders and loaders. Today, it is a shadowy gang that runs crime in big cities, especially smuggling, racketeering, and prostitution. They are considered lowly thugs by most.

recm1WS5iMiJT6tFE.title: Scythichnis Covenant
recm1WS5iMiJT6tFE.desc: A merchant guild founded on the alliance of the Blue and Opal Dragonlords, the Scythichnis are often more interested in acquiring magical objects and knowledge than in trading goods and resources, considering themselves seekers and loremasters. Their hold on precious stones, crystals, and rare minerals still makes them filthy rich, of course.

recsZfAivlJvYU2KU.title: beasts
recsZfAivlJvYU2KU.desc: Not an actual faction, just a shared flag

recw47XlRNaEcWXIg.title: House Venari
recw47XlRNaEcWXIg.desc: House Venari is an old institution uniting merchants and rich aristocrats into a real economic powerhouse of the Empire. They have monopolies on oil and mushrooms but they are very prominent in other businesses as well — and their hold on mercenary companies is quite alarming to the other Houses.

rec5hiDC00hf2FpK3.title: A noble widow and her entourage

rec6VYFh4wjfv5ryn.title: A woman with her Tainted children

recA568qh2cUULgnP.title: High ranking affiliates of the Scythichnis

recD41vrswBIxiH6m.title: Travelers turned back from the south

recFJsH86O8JT1kbm.title: Wyrm Hunters Heading to Tectum Carvos

recFlrgI2atBgt5gc.title: A Crimson Mage and her two slaves

recGto9Jlf7pLm0ux.title: Oghre envoys and their Cadmador guards

recHcoML5QzODqEhU.title: A fat man with two lady friends
recHcoML5QzODqEhU.altitle: the *fat man and his lady friends*

recJNMkhRQdbpxv4x.title: High ranking affiliates of the Guild

recKNI9DEJu4SlXqL.title: A tax collector with two executors

recLR0pWrMqpvnQoF.title: Petrus Abumaria with his pets to sell

recMEEGOrcdxqCYRy.title: High ranking affiliates of the Guild

recMGG5PkCXgeFZON.title: Ahskulite High Priest and his retinue

recVVkTHBQ6gHdYst.title: Lost Travelers Saved by the Sadirar (ST)

recbfGWbtzdL2aFr9.title: A Priest of Ahskul with acolytes

reccRbTps2CDCOC15.title: A naval officer on shore leave

recgivyZ67SOApW7I.title: High ranking affiliates of the Ratharnak

recjHGWKNtwaOXxR4.title: Soon to be liberated tribe members

recmVlLMuXu03OTkq.title: Lost Travelers Saved by the Sadirar (other)

recrfpEZLHyY5uQBB.title: A family trying to start a new life

recsQKk6uH4bILeGp.title: Two children looking for their father

recy2ns2wj3LKzAWe.title: Sergorodite High Priest and his retinue

rec1ux0d9xwCdhjDA.desc: Although Imperials mine their salt using slave labor at the Auguros Work Camp, merchants seem to know that the Scythichnis Covenant sells salt mining licenses in Salum to anyone who can afford it. Sure, it might be poisonous and back-breaking work, but there is a profit to be had for a well-equipped workforce.
rec1ux0d9xwCdhjDA.altdesc: It is for sale if you are interested in mining.

rec4hkbbEHiNtCSQP.desc: The warlike Utvorar are holed up on a volcanic shelf. The talk there is that the Fire Spirit loves to burn wood but the shamans can rarely get any. They also have no arable land, so grain fetches a good price here, too.
rec4hkbbEHiNtCSQP.altdesc: Utvorar is looking for things to burn and eat.

rec5mm1MUdaf7vNJM.desc: Word on the street is that one can find a nice jewelry shop in the Shadow Bazaar of Deven whose proprietor is selling rarities and curios as well. Now you know where to find it.

rec6xvAvSmI5EQe28.desc: The rumor about a sickness that plagues the town's many salt miners circulates in Salum. Those falling ill feel a weakness get hold of them, then soon start to vomit. There are whispers of miners dying. Whatever it is, they seem to have contracted it outside of town.

rec7mE8uyTL7DUp7F.desc: Kernak Waystation is abuzz with traders who now have a lot of unsold merchandise on their hands due to the blockade down south. They say that wine might fetch an especially good price up north.
rec7mE8uyTL7DUp7F.altdesc: Might this be an opportunity in disguise?

rec9kwE3NfjzUFTiJ.desc: Everyone worth their salt knows that the town of Ash has long been converted into a slave trading outpost run mostly by House Darius and independent slavers. Now you know, too. The slave stock is nigh-inexhaustible there and one can even look for specially trained slaves from the Darius Chapterhouse.
rec9kwE3NfjzUFTiJ.altdesc: The largest one in the region.

recAxa6KFl93gQCif.desc: Some people talk enviously, others with outright hostility when it comes to the luxurious sky villas of the nobility of the Shelter. A crew of masons lets you know that at least it gives them work enough to feed their families. However, not enough shipments from the marble from Arken arrive these days for them to stay on schedule.
recAxa6KFl93gQCif.altdesc: The poor struggle, the rich build more villas.

recC8BUkr1e0XvCXa.desc: Rumors circulate that obsidian and metal are much in demand in the city of Deven due to its distance from regions where these resources can be obtained. Perhaps you could make good profit by taking advantage of this?

recErTulb90mFmP80.desc: Travelers you talk to at a tavern show you intricate crystal items they bought from a master Crystalmancer in Lumen. She buys and sells all manner of magic items, too.
recErTulb90mFmP80.altdesc: She is said to dwell near crystals.

recIozPd3s4mkoQb5.desc: You overhear people talking about a Kal-rish fellow who is taking commissions for equipment for /comitati/. Apparently, the craftsman settled down in Crystal, something quite curious for his kind so touched by wanderlust.
recIozPd3s4mkoQb5.altdesc: He dwells in a nearby town.

recJ6in2gQ6Hfcdpw.desc: People talk about the workshop of an alchemist hidden somewhere in the undercity of Tor'Zag's Shelter near Spider Street. The man is reputed for not asking questions.
recJ6in2gQ6Hfcdpw.altdesc: It is somewhere in the Shelter.

recJX2utjDijBIMwv.desc: A mysterious traveler tells you about a weird sculptor who lives in Arken and has a small, hidden shop. It's as if he did not want people to know he is there. Yet he buys and sells all kinds of statues and carvings - perhaps you might be interested in visiting him?
recJX2utjDijBIMwv.altdesc: A mysterious artisan has a shop somewhere.

recJceMnyva3cSd9L.desc: The locals tell you that one of their hunting parties went north and never came back. Death is not uncommon in these parts yet a whole group of hunters disappearing is more than worrisome. They were supposed to return several days ago from the area to the north of Utvorar, near Flametear Lake.

recLbLBJuaX4Jv97Q.desc: A lean fellow with dirt on his cheek complains about the increasing price of wine in the Shelter while it's being flooded with cheap mushroom beer. He clearly preferred the former.

recLe5bpqCu3IY6su.desc: Some vagabonds claim to have seen pale giants roaming the forgotten reaches of the Forsaken Colony. Some also told others who told you that they even talked to these creatures and traded goods. Perhaps it is all hogwash but who knows? Something could be out there.
recLe5bpqCu3IY6su.altdesc: What kind of beings are they?

recN7yM5Gx0ab5MPF.desc: According to locals, there's a fairly hidden trading post out in the Flats about two days almost due southeast of Avernum, run by some #Trading House. There might be a business opportunity there, though a lone wanderer claims that they have some trouble brewing at the outpost.
recN7yM5Gx0ab5MPF.altdesc: Is there something to be had?

recOiF9oROeeFrz4e.desc: There's talk of a bunch of bounties put out by the Avernum's administrators on targets ranging from wild beasts to runaway gladiators. You should visit the Slagfort if you want to earn some coin working as a bounty hunter. The bounty office there will have all the information you need.

recPPfKdJWx6jExlI.desc: Strange, savage warriors are said to visit the Orcscar in the north of the Shelter from time to time. Curious travelers say there are mounds there and riches lie everywhere on the ground. They also say that the place is haunted...
recPPfKdJWx6jExlI.altdesc: Is there something to be had?

recRwxjpdM1ALpULo.desc: People say that the Loaders' Guild is pissed about the shameless smuggling ventures the Wraiths are running in Tor'Zag's. They also openly defy all trade rules in Velarias according to some, bartering with illicit cargo as if those were regular goods.

recSludL40kbOf6oa.desc: The talk is that the Loaders' Guild has taken a notorious Dwarven smuggler prisoner for owing them a small fortune. Perhaps someone could buy him out at the bathhouse in Tor'Zag's Shelter, provided they are on good terms with the /collegium/.
recSludL40kbOf6oa.altdesc: Can someone get him out of it?

recU6kN6Ohn3k3O8E.desc: Ever since that strange earthquake and sudden gale - the one that left people with headaches and strange dreams for weeks - the winds have been more severe out in the wasteland. People have seen legionnaires marching south and claim they went to the Singing Winds.

recVd8c6rxZUmcLpy.desc:
An elderly tracker has just returned to Urvorar from a trip to the desert and reputedly came across something interesting.

'It is a large cave I used to rest in when I'm out among the dunes.' he says after you buy him a drink. 'But now some cursed strangers made camp in it and chased me away. Runaways or renegades, most like. If you want to find them, journey southeast from here for two days, then turn south between the quicksand fields.'

recVhvUtmJI8BryGv.desc: Word is that a /lanista/ and gladiator teacher called Drius has gotten himself into a lot of trouble with the powers to be and now has to fight a gladiator match to clear his name. Yet very few in this city dare to side with someone despised by the high-ups. His compound can be found in the Market District.
recVhvUtmJI8BryGv.altdesc: Perhaps you could help them out?

recXUW1M0gbAJu0sY.desc: There's talk of a horrid desert beast and a whole pack of smaller vermin that follows it around, attacking everyone they come upon in the arid wasteland. They are fairly cunning, setting ambushes and tracking prey. The pack was last seen about two days east of Vitrar.

recYNGUdJTuN5i7fC.desc: Apparently, a desperate bounty hunter went after Krog'Vor and his warband. She tracked the Orcs to Velarias and never came back. Perhaps you can pick up the pieces.

recZ3TaB0knvcbfQg.desc: You have been told that the tribune Iulius Claudius Faustinianis at the Acherus Quarry is looking into slave workforce effectiveness and his 'research' might involve a job for you.
recZ3TaB0knvcbfQg.altdesc: He is looking for a certain expertise.

recapDeRmc8AjXlHP.desc: According to visiting Kal-rish, an ancient, dying wanderer of their kin can be found in a small house near the Kal-rish market in Tor'Zag's Shelter. He might have something to sell you.
recapDeRmc8AjXlHP.altdesc: He might have something to offer.

recbuiLpUXAieEZNf.desc: An old vagabond was blathering about men in black armor sneaking around Terathion's Fall in the south from the Shelter. He may be seeing things due to cheap booze but maybe you could check it out?

recf2CT6XBqzW57Gy.desc: The talk of the town is that in the southern deserts, in the remotest regions, a new threat has emerged that is slowly but steadily making its way to the north. Witnesses claim that creatures writhing beneath the sands attack travelers and smaller settlements. Not even Tectum Carvos can escape this mysterious threat.
recf2CT6XBqzW57Gy.altdesc: Abhorrent creatures roam the southern deserts.

recgbUxWBEM0wb7GR.desc: People talk about savages living in two tribal settlements, one to the south, and another one further southwest of Avernum. These people worship the elements and their shamans are said to be able to heal the most terrible wounds. They are called the #Sadirar.
recgbUxWBEM0wb7GR.altdesc: They are said to live nearby.

rech7KBO56oDOaFxi.desc: Word is that one could find a strange bookshop with an even stranger owner among the shacks and huts of Larnak's slums called the Fields. It reputedly sells rare and interesting books.
rech7KBO56oDOaFxi.altdesc: It sells rare tomes and volumes.

recjUue3LsXdE864N.desc: Word is that the Drusian Quarry on the northwestern edge of Sergorod's Blade produces copious amounts of obsidian that can be hauled east and north for a reliable profit.
recjUue3LsXdE864N.altdesc: The biggest obsidian quarry in the region.

recl8ABPwlru7MBgS.desc: The Mines of Plenty might be a prospecting station first and foremost but due to its position so close to the Dragonlands, it has taken on the role of a trade outpost as well. According to travelers, the Ratharnak Emporium can be found there, which might be interesting to anyone wishing to do business with the industrious Trading House.

recm2HMqxDu37RbAf.desc: There is talk about a strange block of warehouses in Avernum's Scoria district where people have gone missing. Some claim the place is haunted.

recmG9EGVtkxkgWW1.desc: The man in the dark dragonsteel armor told you that there is some kind of trouble brewing at the Hills of Plenty that involves the Ratharnak Alliance and some thieves. The Black Dragonlord's agents seem to be interested in aiding Ratharnak.

recmP2bimm8ogsRfS.desc: There is a man named Tullus Caepasius in Tor'Zag's Shelter who is looking to hire an independent /comitatus/. He can be found in the city's Temple District.

recnQM2rir9M935LZ.desc: Apparently, there is a rich, underground mining site somewhere in the Northwestern Crag in the Hills of Plenty, ripe for the taking.

recppKIloUyrHt94j.desc: While potters do not have a lot of surplus after satisfying local demand in Tor'Zag's, one can export ceramic goods to other settlements fairly reliably. Vagri taking these wares to the crystal forests in the west and beyond speak of good profit.
recppKIloUyrHt94j.altdesc: The potters' guild is happy for once.

recqDVrKC3bKEA1hL.desc: While Avernum is considered to be the main source of metal in the northern Empire with all the scrappers bringing their hauls to smelt in the city, in reality, most shipments of ore arrive at Tor'Zag's from the Mines of Plenty, controlled by the Dragonlords.
recqDVrKC3bKEA1hL.altdesc: Avernum is just too far away.

recrJ00QJOCyvoTXd.desc: Everyone seems to agree that Deven's mushroom beer is the best, especially considering its price. In fact, due to the endless fields where they grow the shrooms in that city, one can buy the beer as well as the raw crop itself at a really good value.

recsMkdnv3AuIIAJ5.desc: People gossip about a strange little shop in Sun Rock, cut into the rock face of a frequented plaza, run by an odd being. Nobody seems to agree on the creature's origin and looks, though. They say it sells curious goods and rare treasures.
recsMkdnv3AuIIAJ5.altdesc: It might be of interest to someone like you.

rect2nHLSvr3DQ7Er.desc: A dark rumor is abounding about the town of Salum. It states that the town's salt production is stunted compared to the presence of the Dragonlords' Trading Houses and therefore all of it is a charade to hide something. People in the know whisper that those speaking of this in Salum disappear quickly.
rect2nHLSvr3DQ7Er.altdesc: The town might not be what it seems.

recuZ88OBxjN1Cgkp.desc: The authorities are said to have closed off the pass in the Sepis Mountains guarded by the Twin Towers and do not let anyone through. The reason has something to do with the strange winds. People are furious, as they had to cut journeys short and turn back. It is bad for business, too.

recwlWtHyf5vauCLD.desc: With Deven being situated wholly underground, it comes as no surprise that people there require ways to produce light more than anywhere else. Brightkelp is said to be extremely sought-after for its ease to handle and persistent glow.

recxR9gz0cmxjnuJB.desc: Asking the right people over at the market reveals that the tribe dwelling in an oasis in the south of Avernum values metal greatly - iron, copper, tin, silver, all exports of this city. Perhaps there is some profit to be made?
recxR9gz0cmxjnuJB.altdesc: Avernum offers goods the Sadirar need.

recy6XBI8yKgKeNcD.desc: The Sadirar hunters whisper about tracks out in the desert, leading to a camp among the endless dunes. It lies about two days southeast of Vitrar. The hunters warn you, however: there is a whole lot of tracks.
recy6XBI8yKgKeNcD.altdesc: It's out there, in the desert.

reczCGZ9jrRBLoSSn.desc: Locals keep mentioning an odd Wraith called Vrak who is haunted by ghosts. At least that is what he claims, perhaps to justify his freakish behavior. But who knows, maybe you can help him out? They say he lives in the Hintercaves.

rec09FfhyVK5awR5r.desc: An independent /comitatus/, no doubt encouraged by one of our rivals, is recruiting fighters to take over one of our sites. Go there and defend the place long enough for our own reinforcements to arrive.

rec0ONKllkp9mq1dU.desc: A group of arrested criminals are to be taken to the place where they will be prosecuted. Tread lightly. Their associates might try to free them from captivity.

rec12HMUlxLyqpkoW.desc: A group of slaves was just smuggled out from a work camp. These poor souls are in dire need of someone to guide them to safety before their escape is discovered.

rec2rnKQDoup0Bprh.desc: One of our isolated quarries in the wasteland is being harassed by %opponent%. Do us a favor and put a hard stop to it. The harder the stop the better. %faction% would like to send a message.

rec2x1j2PLHrIPQzK.desc: A rich merchant who crossed us hired mercenaries for protection. Although we are prohibited from interfering, you could strike at them and abduct the trader’s family for us to be ransomed later.

rec3EucJ5ywVBM9kC.desc: An agent of %opponent% decided to change sides and is now under our protection. She has to be taken to %destination% where she will be safe from our competition.

rec3iARRhBjWOhO4Z.desc: A nobleman’s daughters were kidnapped to leverage him into lobbying for trading rights for %opponent%. %Faction% decided to pay for their rescue if only to convince the father to lobby for them.

rec444UVyalXkCycE.desc: We received reports that some of their forces of an otherwise heavily guarded work camp were temporarily reassigned. Strike before they return and bring as many of our freed brothers to %destination% as you can.

rec4CASSND1TmJWMN.desc: Who knows what draws these accursed Undead to certain locations? We are in no rush to find out but want to be rid of this specific herd nonetheless as it is too close to our assets in the region.

rec4v3eG7ZElepVMK.desc: The local authorities are becoming too bold for their own good. %Faction% will set their priorities straight by abducting some of their family members and friends but we need your expertise for the job.

rec5EZRj6iDPVN7Aj.desc: We want you to take a remote but strategically important site owned by an unaffiliated group for us. It is essential that our involvement does not get back to Imperial authorities, so be thorough.

rec5y63GPSlAmil4V.desc: A noble who crossed us hired mercenaries for protection. Although we are prohibited from assaulting them, you could stage an attack and abduct the noble’s family for us to be ransomed later.

rec6U6TLFPnJlNTSh.desc: Someone was foolish enough to disturb haunted ruins close to our outpost and now the accursed things keep attacking our agents in the area. Make short work of them.

rec7kWu8Krhk6xLZG.desc: A Tainted mob overrun a small outpost the few people who managed to escape asked for our help. Rescue the remaining survivors quickly. Who knows what they will do to them.

rec7wm28B1iOu9hjf.desc: Devoted servants of our Church have been abducted by our enemies disguised as an Imperial /comitatus/. We can not let them suffer at the hands of traitors. Rescue them and take them to safety.

rec7xz2QkZaBMKXw1.desc: An unaffiliated /comitatus/ is undercutting our business by delivering cargo cheaper and quicker. Since they refuse to be bought out, we would like you to find a less subtle solution to our problem.

rec8K9DvIvLxTzvtQ.desc: The Imperials press false claims about some of our people and dispatched a unit to capture them. We cannot let that happen, of course, so we are entrusting you to protect them on their journey.

rec9KeXNuQNV4Lg8d.desc: One of our key trading partners was abducted by mercenaries hired by people he owes big money. Instead of paying the ransom, we would pay you to liberate him and deal with the captors.

rec9xymCtDqzjaIoR.desc: Criminal elements associated with %opponent% are threatening nearby roads. Although little more than highwaymen, they must be interrogated, so capture some and kill the rest.

recAEjyZbolC8OX69.desc: Normally, we would ask you to massacre these escaped slaves but some of them are too valuable for that and so you are to capture them so that they can be returned to their esteemed owners.

recAVuGjZbYNRJPOI.desc: %Opponent% has confiscated our assets and they closed off all regular avenues to reclaim them. Maybe they would be more sensible if we offered something equally important, like some of their own people.

recBMVVAKKUQ7jITx.desc: Our scouts found a site that could serve as an ideal bogweed farm due to its fertile soil. Unfortunately, it is currently occupied by %opponent%. Clear out the place so our people can begin farming.

recBQqc5F8dxBhbVY.desc: The lawlessness of these so-called guilds vex mighty Sergorod. The criminal elements of %opponent% gathering %location% shall be expunged in our glory and you are the weapon we chose for the task.

recC7pjJphj4P9eig.desc: A horde of unliving abominations keep circling one of our remote outposts. It will surely fall unless you can make it there in time and defend the site from the Undead.

recCE7icAGx4Oajy4.desc: Our leaders need to reach our camp %location% then travel to %destination%. Unfortunately, %opponent% considers our journey through their lands as trespassing so you might need to defend them against their attacks.

recDKvXMmcKMAh8wk.desc: We learned that a noble is trying to reanimate his children who died to a plague. He hired outlaws to abduct some of our acolytes who are on a pilgrimage to %destination%.

recDLSlemm9kmDZMH.desc: The occasional raid here and there is all fine but this outlaw gang has become a thorn in our side. %faction% can not allow their despicable actions to continue so wipe them off the face of the Realms.

recDa4lvRjCGgVIJ5.desc: The movement’s resources are running a little low. The plan is to abduct wealthy merchants who reside %location%. Their associates will pay some serious coin in exchange for their life.

recDpv1AP1mfPc61p.desc: A work camp not too far from here is run by Sergorod-worshipping zealots. Raid and destroy it to weaken the Church’s standing and forces in the region.

recDzrL2KKZYM6oJl.desc: An unaffiliated /comitatus/ aided a local nobleman's son in escaping from an arranged marriage. See that he is returned unharmed and destroy his accomplices for involving themselves in this matter.

recFA2CduJh5a8wbV.desc: The Imperials claim that we are holding one of theirs at an off-site location. Ridiculous, /of course/. We do have other interests there, though. Defend the site until we get everything we need.

recFGHlsQaIribKOk.desc: A bunch of runaway slaves wish to join a liberated tribe out in the wilderness. This proves difficult as they do not know how to traverse the wasteland. They need guidance by a skilled wayfarer such as you.

recFMcKW7vHDbywP7.desc: A noble family came to us for help: some of their members were abducted recently. Given their good standing with %faction%, we would like to finance their rescue by your /comitatus/.

recFT8pk1zXGM7sJt.desc: The Empire’s agents have set their eyes on some of our sympathizers. It is only a matter of time before they capture them, except if you can escort them to %destination% where they can be initiated into our ranks.

recFqSHgR7CM8QVkw.desc: %Faction% is interested in a remote but valuable site for future exploitation. We want you to clear a lair of beasts in the area first, as it is too close to the place.

recGA4B8Iq5CtedN2.desc: A wayward prospecting team sent us an arcane message about being pressured on all sides by beasts and other threats. They will not be able to return with their detailed report without an escort.

recGjgNeFYD3Qprm8.desc: A group of our most devoted members is on a mission. They need to get to %location% to do their work for the movement. It is paramount that they get there without hindrance - so make sure they do.

recGyVZp6aaCm8Tnz.desc: We captured some agents who we believe are working for %opponent% incognito. Take them to the site of their interrogation but take care: if they are truly insurgents, their true allies can show up.

recHLAfqC8IVsKDnf.desc: The single priest overlooking a remote shrine sent us a message that Undead roam in the area and threaten to overrun the place. Lend your hand and protect the holy site.

recIN1XWGrMY8uPZW.desc: After learning of a /comitatus/ that is going to escort a group of merchants, our agents planned a raid along their route. Kidnap the traders for us and take them to %destination%.

recIstPcnuQx3HVXF.desc: We received reports from our agents of a loremaster currently working with %opponent%, whose knowledge would be highly beneficial to one of our researches. We need you to get him.

recIwvtCoLnQRADAJ.desc: %Faction% wants you to take an arcane researcher to take some measurements out in the wasteland, then escort her to debriefing. Be wary, though: our competitors want to prevent this at any cost.

recJ3rZplGgX7EEyT.desc: We obtained information about the location of a %opponent% hideout. Verifying this would be too much of a risk for us but you could figure it out and eliminate their agents.

recJGDqqYAVxBEMI7.desc: Our new mine has to be defended against a pack of ferocious beasts that keep harassing our people there. Do not take too long because we are running out of workers.

recJUeerZUeJPb9Pk.desc: We have learned of an understaffed Imperial army camp in the region. In case of an attack, nearby settlements would surely send troops for their aid and our other agents would be able to work better in those settlements.

recJWHY9mmHYjQts3.desc: They are going for our stash %location%, the bloody %opponent%. Hold them off until we can relocate all our hidden loot from there to a safer place.

recK0t2sTPesXmvTD.desc: Our adversaries openly steal from us, having built an outpost on the border of our territory and attacked our assets repeatedly. %faction% will not abide this. Wipe them out in our name.

recKALvD5rLO3O6MX.desc: The leaders of these runaway slaves - once interrogated - might aid us in locating and striking at other similar armed groups. Grab as many of them as you can.

recKdzJ7KddztYCXJ.desc: Our sources uncovered a site infested with slave-lovers who are plotting an attack on the very foundations of our great Empire. Deal with them with the utmost cruelty in the name of Sergorod.

recKgUrfePQZzcbP6.desc: A prominent noble has contacted us to track down some independent traders who sold him marble of poor quality. We are too busy but you could make an example out of them and be rewarded for your trouble.

recLitwc7BwOZxECj.desc: %Opponent% have overrun one of the remote necropolises. Disperse them and hold the place long enough for our acolytes to consecrate the place against further attacks.

recLsNcO81Sc8bfhW.desc: Our competition was foolish enough to keep some key agents at a remote location. %Faction% wants you to grab some of these agents quietly and bring them here for interrogation.

recMKzcUSkwA1whG6.desc: The blasted Imperials have blockaded our outpost where we have the valuables of our associates stashed away. We need you to wipe them out so that we can get the loot.

recMWgHlyQrfyXGvt.desc: One of our acolytes needs protection on the way to %destination% due to threats from a wasteland mob blaming her for their leader’s botched burial ritual.

recMuJeUrLidroQHK.desc: The Carpenters seem to have built a base of operation out in the wilderness. Uncharacteristic as it may be, they need to be ambushed and captured so that they can be questioned thoroughly.

recMv2PKrXFDwZQ3g.desc: We have received reports that independent slavers are planning to recapture the members of one of our liberated camps %location%. Seek out and kill those bastards before they can enact their nefarious plan.

recNILTS0Df9UUtWy.desc: A gang of outlaws is responsible for killing some of our slaves in transit. Destroy their camp to teach them not to touch %faction%’s property ever again.

recNSSXQ7tufkS7MO.desc: The Imperials put some affiliates of ours under house arrests and powers from within the Dragon Lands want them to be moved into permanent safely. Break through their guards and bring them to %destination%.

recO1RSl1YTsZuWru.desc: %Opponent% have been spotted near our fortified camp at the edge of our territories and we need to send reinforcements in a hurry.

recOCVErn1vi43B63.desc: A rogue Necromancer must have perished and the leftover Undead are now roaming uncontrolled close to our outpost. We will be grateful if you destroy them.

recOJK6Co6QB75PoJ.desc: A slaver crew ambushed one of our camps to capture our brothers. They sold most of them back to slavery but kept the leaders waiting for a better price from the authorities. You have to free them before they could fall in their hands.

recOWBhN7xe2F0SWZ.desc: An unaffiliated group had the gall to abduct some of our allies and are now blackmailing us. Go to their hideout and try to get the hostages out one way or the other.

recOeJhnhWHhwS0LJ.desc: We caught members from a certain tribe selling goods that were stolen from us. Since the local authorities are too slow to act on this matter, we were hoping you would help us out.

recOeyn6nlfwtwPBx.desc: %Faction% requires you to take a small detachment of our soldiers who have to secure a remote site where a group of our agents disappeared while surveying the area.

recP3ImbuUmlYJlmV.desc: Lately, a liberated tribe ally camp has been plagued by repeated attacks of %opponent% that come crawling out of the wasteland, wreaking great havoc and endangering their hard-earned foothold. Take them out.

recPSfi2uUv4mOXnC.desc: Ungodly creatures raided a small village and slaughtered everyone. Our acolytes arrived but the %opponent% are still there. We need you to clear the area and defend the place until the burials are performed.

recQ1CIKSLaAtm6jm.desc: Word has reached us about an Imperial comitatus that traverses these parts. Several high-ranking bureaucrats are among its passengers. Taking them out should deal serious damage to the Empire’s apparatus.

recQ60n4QuvbzWu5b.desc: %Faction% has taken interest in one of our tribal camps for whatever dubious reason. Our people there are on their last legs. We need you to rush to their aid and drive away the invaders.

recQFSH57i62kEDJM.desc: Mercenaries hired by %opponentForRep% keep raiding our remote outpost in a bold attempt at conquering it eventually. We would like you to go there and teach them never to do that again.

recQVlXqZgjp5ebEH.desc: A sizable group of %opponent% turned up at one of our distant outposts and are disrupting %faction%’s venture there. Make them disappear and you will be handsomely rewarded.

recQfxrGrxVPmbFtP.desc: The accursed slave-lovers and their bandit friends are raiding our holdings near a shrine in the wasteland. Take your forces there and protect it from the accursed Abolitionists.

recR2hjO3Y4P1UOsj.desc: We received word about a potential informant who wishes to betray %opponent% and join us. The rendezvous point is out in the wilderness but recovering him might still prove risky.

recR7Lfdxbado52OU.desc: Clandestine schemes are being worked behind our lines, and the perpetrators can be caught off guard. Apply a furtive approach and abduct the operatives, then bring them to us.

recRJv1Y7dMpV4Y7u.desc: Certain acolytes of %opponent% have uncovered an ancient site and are extremely tight-lipped about it, which can only mean that it is worth a lot. We must learn about it before our competition. Bring some of them to us.

recRbEOVjmtGCRsdj.desc: One of our bookkeepers has to travel to an outpost %location% for an official inquiry. This is an opportunity for our foes to sabotage us, so protect the scribe at all costs.

recRd4tRrHaZI2ME1.desc: Our secluded harvesting site is constantly raided by %opponent% and it is time to put an end to that. Go there and eliminate this nuisance so that operations can resume and yields become satisfactory.

recRlE0EYqAldgGSJ.desc: We received news that a gang of outlaws are attacking a holy site and have to be educated about the depth of their folly. Permanently.

recRy86BJ9uM8gFOT.desc: A recently re-captured slave offered intriguing information about an Imperial /vagrus/ smuggling runaway slaves to liberated tribes. We need you to bring them in to share all the details with our inquisitors.

recRzO0EvutkNfUUl.desc: Some escaped slaves are to be destroyed before they organize themselves into pitiful but dangerous bands. May Sergorod grant you the might to crush them.

recTEGzjORWN27P2j.desc: Some of our acolytes have to be taken to a remote location to perform a mass burial. You need to protect them from the unhinged savages of that region who believe that the ritual is sacrilege.

recTkEbZusPIt6wct.desc: One of our key trading partners was abducted by people she owes big money to. Instead of paying the ransom, we would pay you to liberate her and deal with the captors.

recTkdpIx9r6chxQ1.desc: Our negotiations with %opponent% fell through and we learned that they are trying to hit a group of our people leaving from here. We need you to guard their journey %location% until they reach %destination%.

recTzXnjpTyMFeIKN.desc: The Empire often entrusts the organization of work camps to %faction%. One of the camps is constantly attacked by %opponent% who keep freeing slaves. This has to stop.

recUPZVSDvl9BfZPw.desc: Wildlife is getting the better of our outpost in the area, so we need someone competent to dispose of the beasts. %faction% will be most pleased if you succeed.

recUYxLWDdHwfUwGy.desc: One of our /comitati/ was surprised by an arcane storm in the middle of the wasteland. The survivors found refuge in nearby caves but can not leave without a rescue party.

recUgPeeDRKB9boIq.desc: Some recently liberated slaves were beset by %opponent% while on their way to join a larger tribe. Right now they are out there in the wasteland, unable to reach their destination. Go and lend them a helping hand.

recUvzqLcGSabS41M.desc: %Opponent% expanded their hunting grounds in an unfortunate direction and now threaten our trade routes. Since the local agents can not deal with this, we want you to clean it up for us.

recUxFJPEyA7suU7D.desc: %Opponent% corrupts more and more city officials with the money they raise through their extensive smuggling network operated from outposts in the wasteland. Take out the one we located recently.

recV0DPuyVbwfcsRl.desc: The Church requires you to escort one of our high priests to an upcoming religious ceremony in %destination%. Make sure that he gets there safely and in time.

recV83e37U1jvhE4v.desc: We have a dispute with the authorities over a minor matter but they prove too stubborn. We need you to abduct some of their loved ones to open their minds to negotiation.

recVPChOPnoqfOyHw.desc: %Opponent% had the gall to take our outpost and %faction% can not abide such conduct. You are to be our instrument in reclaiming what is ours. Make sure to stay until we can reinforce the site.

recVdmbeTPZUaVtzu.desc: Sand Wyrms keep attacking outposts and villages all over the Searing Plains. Unless you can defend this one until our reinforcements arrive, %faction% will certainly lose it.

recVuFZKtuijUEbDn.desc: Word came in about a lowly hit squad working for the Loaders, preying on upstanding citizens out in the wasteland. You are to locate them and capture the fools for interrogation.

recW1eS22rRz6bGqR.desc: An agitator was exiled for fomenting unrest and he is now gathering a following in the wasteland. Hunt him down and the hotheads that have rallied themselves to his cause.

recXRAPAfmoqE2HXR.desc: A number of graves have been disturbed, causing Undead to attack travelers. These abominations must be driven off before the cemetery can be restored. This is where you come in.

recXqyfDAKhFcbo3n.desc: One of our liberated tribe camps is under continuous threat by %opponent% dwelling nearby. They are way too territorial to deal with in any other way than eliminating them. It has to be done, and you are the perfect person to make it happen.

recXtutSefqwg7iGQ.desc: We have proof that a local merchant has been aiding those wretched slave-lovers. He fled to the wasteland but we found them %location%. Execute Sergorod’s righteous wrath on them.

recYNBcKF0WtE2eX3.desc: A handful of runaway slaves has sought our help. Their goal is to reach %destination% but on their own they will surely perish in the wasteland. Accompany them and help them get to their destination.

recYQ5Khuka1r464N.desc: The Church wishes you to escort a high priest to one of the remote holy sites, the gravesite of a Saint, then onwards to %destination%.

recYUpQYuTtYcUJAH.desc: A few of our new supporters wish to join a cell in another settlement but first they must get there, which is no easy feat. They need someone to lead the way.

recYjTHqMcgVj6muS.desc: The Imperials pressed false claims about some of our agents and dispatched a unit to capture them. We can not go up against the Empire but you can protect them on their journey without causing a major incident.

recZETZRALsMb0aWG.desc: As it turns out, one of our outposts was built way too close to a lair of %opponent% and the creatures keep attacking relentlessly. %faction% would be grateful if you could deal with the matter.

recZNHGjuIdXm6qc6.desc: %Faction% is looking to take ownership of a small, but successful independent /comitatus/. Intercept them for us and liquidate their assets.

recZS1UipcEXdhugo.desc: We are in dire need of information about our enemies, specifically the Church of Sergorod. A handful of their acolytes reside at a work camp near %location%. Infiltrate the camp and capture some of them.

recaIRYK9gBDfAGKk.desc: Dire news! Some of our liberated tribe leaders were recaptured and brought into a work camp out in the wasteland. Seek out the camp and free those poor souls - the movement depends on it.

recaPqT1nNHv4Bv34.desc: One of our talented acolytes has been captured and forced to raise Undead for our enemies. Return him to us unharmed before they have enough shamblers to start raiding small settlements.

recamoIc8EGM2KYPc.desc: After a successful purging of %opponent% recently, their fellows in crime are trying to take revenge on anyone heading to our faction outposts. We need an escort.

recbDK91PKlrlvFOt.desc: Several of our experienced agents have been captured by %opponent% and we can not allow their captors to extract sensitive information from them - bust them out before they do so.

recbOwU5Lp341AJeG.desc: A band of Scortaur has attacked lone travelers on our territory. It is only a matter of time before they grow confident enough to harass our /comitati/. Take them out before that happens.

recbSmyk2loHxisMI.desc: Thanks to the treason of slave lovers, a sizable gang of runaways is gathering in the wasteland. Deliver our vengeance to them and you shall be granted much deserved boons.

recbYXW0alvnVeCgi.desc: Our agents will use a temporary realmgate to return from the Outer Realms. Unfortunately, the portal will leave them in the middle of the wasteland so they will have to be escorted back.

recbd7wytWSrs1ELI.desc: Some of our people got cut off when an Undead horde appeared in an area where we had an operation. They need a capable crew to cut through the abominations and bring the isolated crew to safety.

recbteuRQTuPMhr4A.desc: One of our liberated tribe camps is besieged by %opponent%. There is no hope for the site itself but maybe our people could get to safety if you held back our enemies for long enough.

reccNgKYB3czLcYrV.desc: A group of slaves just snuck away from another comitatus. We need a trustworthy crew to guide them to safety %destination% where the Movement will take care of their permanent placement.

reccpQWMtsBHy21Uu.desc: A group of %opponent% has been slowly moving in a straight line for months. We expect them to cross a busy trade route soon, and want you to prevent any accidents from harming local trade.

reccy3FeEcYP4gvfX.desc: After learning of a /comitatus/ that is going to escort a cadre of aristocrats, our agents planned a raid along their route. Kidnap the nobles for us and take them to %destination%.

reccybw4A6OGpQFLj.desc: %Faction% has learned of a wilderness hideout where Abolitionists gather in secret. You are to stealthily approach the place and grab some of them so that they can be questioned by ours.

recdavzruE0WLat84.desc: Some of our surveyors reported having difficulties due to %opponent% roaming the area they worked in, then they went silent. They might have got trapped and need assistance with getting out of there.

recdbvO0uQvPV9O4z.desc: Prospectors of %opponent% have struck a small but rich vein close to our territory. Eliminate the troops guarding the mine and defeat any reinforcements they may send until our main force arrives.

recdmEAZWFQjmky6p.desc: An especially vicious Scortaur has gathered a number of its kin and has made its nest close to our territories. Drive them off for us before they disrupt trade in the region.

receSvPFdZoMFu6pn.desc: We have made a generous offer to an outlaw group to do our bidding and they had the audacity to refuse it. Taking some of their comrades under our protection seems like the right step to move forward.

receVyJq3a97eCSYm.desc: Several captured Abolitionist leaders have to be escorted to another location for questioning. As usual, their slave-lover friends might make an attempt to bust them out.

recepjDEyKWi8GwSM.desc: Several captured suspected Abolitionists need to be escorted to another location for questioning. As usual, their slave-lover friends might make an attempt to bust them out.

receqwb8yYk5IjycU.desc: The mad leader of a horde of Tainted proclaimed that his successor must come from %faction% and so they now regularly attack our people on the road. Protect our next group heading to %destination% from them.

receuBfY38kVYTFFb.desc: We received word about a potential informant who wishes to betray %opponent% and join us. The rendezvous point is out in the wilderness but recovering him might still prove risky.

recfXnV14QdVi2ups.desc: Important members of the Church sent word about %opponent% roaming the area they were in. They might have got trapped and now we need your expertise in finding them and bringing them back.

recfaE5HsYIlnnHSF.desc: Some associates of %faction% asked us to provide an escort for them on their journey to %destination% as they received credible threats recently. We need you to fulfill that task on our behalf.

recfyF2LUAVfx6pjk.desc: %Opponent% forces have been spotted near our fortified camp at the edge of our territories and we need to send reinforcements in a hurry.

recg9EgT5QbOWMUub.desc: %Opponent% tried to abduct one of our high-ranking affiliates so they decided to relocate to %destination%. Take them there but expect our foe to make an attempt at preventing you from doing so.

rechMJMbhx56c8bUl.desc: A warband of Orcs is responsible for killing some of our slaves at the market. Destroy their camp to teach them not to touch %faction%’s property again.

rechrWTpVq9XzBBN9.desc: The /bestiarii/ in the local arena have slaughtered most %opponent%, so we will reward you handsomely for clearing out this dwelling of the creatures. Then our handlers can move in and scoop up the rest.

rechyBFGlTIvWEsbn.desc: A marauding Orc warband’s warriors might know about where other such raiders keep slipping into Dragonlord territory. We would like to ask them, so bring some of them here.

recilc5xXw59OTWuj.desc: The movement needs military intel if it is to thrive and so we must question officers of the Imperial legions. Bring us venerated soldiers of the enemy - no easy task, but we are sure that you will manage.

recjB82jMoYXTn4Ij.desc: We received intel about an Imperial comitatus with important passengers. The information we could extract from them would greatly benefit the Movement. Bring them to us by any means necessary.

recjOQPiOEAzpvKCp.desc: Affiliates of %faction% are to be escorted to another site to negotiate a deal in our name. Needless to say, %opponent% will not sit idly while we are claiming new assets, so expect opposition.

recjnol9h6mJ2fSmX.desc: It appears that an apprentice of a recently slain Necromancer has decided to continue their former master's work and started raising Undead near our mine. Kill them before this becomes a problem.

recjwnBDQTwxcGurA.desc: %Faction% has been offered a sizable donation by a third party in return for liberating some people who were abducted by a freelancer /comitatus/. A part of that donation goes to the one doing the rescuing.

recl6zPa615lNefyG.desc: Our adversaries openly steal from us, having built an outpost on the border of our territory and attacked our assets repeatedly. %faction% will not abide this. Wipe them out in our name.

recm9GlL25c1q6pLa.desc: We received a plea for help from one of our supporters who got into trouble with %opponent%. The issue is not related to our cause, yet we feel obliged to help out any sympathizers in trouble.

recoE78WiiK8PPkHl.desc: Several of our experienced agents have been captured by %opponent% and we can not allow their captors to extract sensitive information from them - bust them out before they do so.

recoIF5WaM6fC1RAJ.desc: A handful of slaves were just smuggled out from a work camp. Their goal is to reach %destination% but on their own they will surely perish in the wasteland. Accompany them and help them get to their destination.

recp8ryNbO3cDl8sU.desc: The competition seems to have let its guard down and the time for us to strike is at hand. We have a target for you in a contested region - it has to be held until our larger force relieves you.

recpDocgenkPPRmgf.desc: We need Orcs for a commemoration ceremony coming up and a savage warband has just turned up for the occasion. Capture as many as you can and we will be most grateful.

recpSnttKAN1nwjNY.desc: %Opponent% forces have been spotted near our fortified camp at the edge of our territories and we need to send reinforcements in a hurry.

recpXdWsbqHnpEsC8.desc: Take our officials to a strategic location in contested territory, then, once their business is concluded, to %destination%. Our rivals may strike at any time during your journey.

recq5ImHm6vtfXM5B.desc: A handful of slaves just snuck away from another comitatus. Their goal is to reach %destination% but on their own they will surely perish in the wasteland. Accompany them and help them get to their destination.

recqCmjNy8rQ00Enm.desc: We obtained information about the location of a %opponent% hideout. Verifying this would be too much of a risk for us but you could figure it out and eliminate their agents.

recqEefG8OYMnDkTF.desc: Some mortal souls of the wasteland decided to set up their camp at a sacred burial site and that shall not stand. Push them out and defend the place long enough that they give up and leave.

recrAkgzDkLqjhAE9.desc: A handful of our agents were captured by slavers - most likely those bastards do not even know that they caught Abolitionists. At any rate, find them and bust them out.

recs2Rq2mHbetaPXV.desc: Despite our efforts to secure a mutually beneficial deal with an influential Imperial noble family, they now accuse us of trying to strongarm them. Bring them here so that we can clear this up in person.

recsKOh2iGBRg3I5e.desc: Tainted crazies are trying to get into our site %location% and our defenses are faltering. We need you to hurry to our people’s aid and push the filthy horde back to where it belongs: the wasteland.

recseJw89Z0pwn9mI.desc: Our spies report that %opponent% set up a camp at a strategic point near our territory. We would pay a fair price to someone taking the location for us and holding it until relieved.

recsxP94cnHBkrmx2.desc: The competition seems to have let its guard down and the time for us to strike is at hand. We have a target for you in a contested region - it has to be held until our larger force relieves you.

rect8ABc2UbcZNH88.desc: Some doors remain shut to us, so we must influence certain people in high positions. We want you to abduct an Imperial officer’s closest family so that we can gain leverage with them.

rectRuiPZbH9MbIcI.desc: Our scouts located a %opponent% lair but it is quite far from our territories. If you can massacre them, we would be able to move in and claim much coveted trophies and components.

rectcn8aQegnxmBKH.desc: We learned that %opponent% has a gap in their defenses at a faraway outpost. Use this knowledge to grab the people who work and live there so we can use them as bargaining chips.

recu0L71qxPtoGtJK.desc: The Empire placed some of our sympathizers under house arrest in a villa just recently. If you could free them, they would find it in their hearts to dedicate themselves wholly to our cause.

recuBE8M35DhJEKTw.desc: Take our magistrate to a strategic location in contested territory, then, once their business is concluded, to %destination% for debriefing. Expect resistance on the way.

recuHJZYsUdGsr6bb.desc: Supporters of the Movement need to be taken to %destination% where they hope to shake the investigators of the Church. We believe that the inquisition will be on the hunt, so expect the worst.

recuIBO8mpgltt6D9.desc: A marauding Orc warband’s warriors might know about where other such raiders keep slipping into Imperial territory. We will need live captives to interrogate, of course.

recuNjyeLxpTYD23e.desc: We have identified a suitable site for our operations %location% but there are %opponent% swarming the area. Push them out and hold the position until we raise sufficient defences to keep them off.

recuR75uvqg6HeoH6.desc: A persistent pack of beasts are preying on our novices near a remote holy site where they are being trained by our priests. Since they do not have the means to get rid of them, you will have to.

recuabNN4dKqKjm2t.desc: Devoted supporters of %faction% need to reach an outpost %location%, then arrive at %destination%. You are to protect them on the way from anyone wanting to do them harm.

recuoP7GRsDxgr7dO.desc: We have a frightened informant who is only willing to talk to agents he knows personally. For this reason, he has to be taken to our headquarters in %destination% where his old contacts work now.

recvENEiLekhj5EM7.desc: %Opponent% had the gall to take our outpost and %faction% can not abide such conduct. You are to be our instrument in reclaiming what is ours. Make sure to stay until we can reinforce the site.

recvfFiCT9mJwEjac.desc: %Faction% has a clear stance on banditry, especially when our assets are becoming the targets of such vile actions. Go there and end these outlaws for us. Your reward will be most adequate.

recvgyJha7emKifI4.desc: An outlaw gang at the edge of our territory is impertinent enough to keep sacking one of our isolated bases. A show of force from your crew would surely take away their will to do it again.

recvq5VtENNIGRWzu.desc: Some followers of %opponent% possess knowledge of the whereabouts of a valuable artifact. You just need to bring them here, we will take care of the extracting of information.

recwCphXfQ6z2Q6Q9.desc: The Empire often entrusts the organization of work camps to %faction%. One of the camps is constantly attacked by %opponent% who keep stealing slaves. This has to stop.

recwCuDnzEvFlJxMD.desc: We need a distraction near an Imperial watchtower with a small garrison so that we can do a troublesome job. A decisive attack on it would be distracting enough.

recwdRRbRfxtKDMhe.desc: We learned that a noble is trying to reanimate his children who died of plague. He hired outlaws to abduct some of our acolytes on a pilgrimage %location% before going to %destination%.

recwfz7H5J68vicwN.desc: A Tainted mob overrun one of our outposts but a few of our people managed to escape. They saw others forced by the madmen to join them. Rescue them quickly. Who knows what they will do to them.

recwooCrqXeOKdTN9.desc: Something has been drawing Undead to a location on our territory. We must find out what is causing this but do not have the resources to remove them right now, so you will have to do it for us.

recx1SloJBbSU7o9i.desc: Our scouts found a site that could be an ideal hideout for the movement. Unfortunately, it is currently occupied by %opponent%. Clear out the place so that our people can claim the shelter.

recxQ7spfjHzysq0D.desc: A group of independent slavers has set its eyes on one of our tribal camps, assuming it will be easy prey. Go and show to them the error of their ways.

recxR3V0T3KQG0Chk.desc: Our spies report that %opponent% set up a camp at a strategic point near our territory. We would pay a fair price to someone taking the location for us and holding it until relieved.

recxcxwSyEfsy9nBd.desc: A group of slaves just broke free from an Imperial work camp. Although they are free, the whole wasteland now lies before them. Those poor souls are in dire need of someone to guide them to safety.

recxyr0JGYOdk9DQb.desc: Imperials believe themselves untouchable. Here is where you come into the picture. We need you to bring a few individuals to us. They are reluctant to comply, so you will have to be very convincing.

recyowuAb9joF5wfN.desc: A merchant has set up shop near one of our secret hideouts. He is not our enemy per se but there is a chance of him becoming aware of our dealings and we cannot risk him alerting the authorities.

recz3Mdn0ESw8FzqW.desc: Our spies report that %opponent% set up a camp at a strategic point near our territory. We would pay a fair price to someone taking the location for us and holding it until relieved.

reczIfr2gBdFcITxS.desc: Our acolytes heard a rumor that a former mentor of theirs who turned rogue will try to kidnap some of them during their journey to %destination%. We need your services to ease their minds as well as ours.

reczvmsd8e1vui007.desc: The neighboring %opponent% felt that our camp attracted too much attention from the Imperial authorities. They captured our tribe leaders and forced the rest of the camp to disperse. Hurry to their rescue, we need their experience to resettle soon.

reczzsRU7KcNsKxKf.desc: Escaped slaves turned marauders keep attacking our supply lines. While our enforcers are occupied elsewhere, it falls to you to put a stop to this audacity.

nod21gp3LdWCr69c603n.title: The Last Oasis
nod21gp3LdWCr69c603n.desc: There is no way to say whether this large oasis is indeed the westermost one but the tiny outpost of sandstone huts and ragged tents at its heart is certainly the last place to grant any kind of comfort so far west from the cities of terra supra. Palm trees sway gently in the warm desert wind and in their shades, azure lakes stretch far and wide - a drop of green-blue in the endless yellow.

nod3naj3LdUa269c6033.title: Fort Viridium
nod3naj3LdUa269c6033.desc: Saddling the cracked, blackened mountain peaks of Sergorod’s Blade, this Imperial fortress of dark stone and spiked battlements commands an awe-inspiring view of the surrounding bleak lands. For long centuries it has stalwartly guarded the region from the numerous enemies of the Empire. Scores of grim legionnaires occupy its vast barracks and great towers. It behooves you to watch your step here.

nod3x8R3LdUNx69c600U.title: The Writhing Oasis
nod3x8R3LdUNx69c600U.desc: Once a tranquil glade of pristine lakes and billowing palm trees in a volcanic basin, the oasis transformed into a twisted, corrupted, noxious mass of plant life that moves in ways no flora should. No sane soul enters, as this place is death.

nod4hLq3LdUmW69c600N.title: Mines of Plenty
nod4hLq3LdUmW69c600N.desc: The echo of falling pickaxes and back-breaking labour permeate the small mining settlement beneath the great cliffs that separate the Empire and the Dragonlands. Still, the distinct stench of reptiles is strong here, and the quarries, overseen by the Ratharnak Alliance and the Dragon Armies, supply the treasuries and furnaces of the Dragonlords. Such an abundance of ore in the metal-starved world is a lure few can resist.

nod4Ni33LdWHX69c604Z.title: Drusian Quarry
nod4Ni33LdWHX69c604Z.desc: Prosperous beyond belief, the huge, terraced quarry at the tip of Sergorod’s Blade is the pride of House Oquo, whose bleak banner flies high on guard towers and administrative buildings alike while a veritable army of slaves and free workers toil day and night to get the best obsidian the region can offer, only for it to be fashioned into blades and spearheads for an army that keeps them in check.

nod5n8z3KmLqu035000y.title: Scrapheap
nod5n8z3KmLqu035000y.desc: At the foot of the ever-fuming mountains of the ancient Dwarven kingdom lies Scrapheap, the town of scavengers. Debris and junk is piled into veritable hills, upon which the rickety homes of the decrepit inhabitants stand precariously. Ash lingers everywhere and the sun is almost always absent from the twilit skies. Deals are struck day and night over the precious metal scraps gathered in the ruins of nearby Dvendar Tharr while the Heap King oversees all from his dreaded tower. Shady eyes in soot-covered faces watch from under ash-laden awnings. Life is cheaper than iron here, some say.

nod651j3LdY1C69c6008.title: Fort Larius
nod651j3LdY1C69c6008.desc: The old fortress of Larius has stood at the center of these forsaken plains for many centuries - manned and vigilant until its tragic fall during the Orc Wars. It has been a hollow, wind-swept, weather-beaten ruin ever since, though not without the occasional raiders or liberated tribe to settle inside its crumbling walls and shattered battlements. Whoever sets up shop here must want to avoid attention from surrounding powers badly enough to move out to the middle of nowhere.

nod694b3LdXBL69c6006.title: Tectum Carvos
nod694b3LdXBL69c6006.desc: They say that history repeats itself but they rarely say that it also has a cruel sense of irony. Both are true to Tectum Carvos, this frontier town built inside halls and tunnels dug into cliffs long ago by giant worm-like creatures - creatures whose descendants keep returning over and over again to snuff out all life here. And yet the settlers also come back to Tectum Carvos, as if trying to prove to the Gods that with enough willpower, mortals can thrive in even the most hostile of environments.

nod6hNd3LeUf469c600N.title: Deven
nod6hNd3LeUf469c600N.desc: While the original site of Deven is nothing more than a stretch of rocky desert watched over by the silent, pitch-black columns of the Spires, the settlement did survive into the Fourth Age. The endless labyrinth of huge cavernous halls and twisting natural tunnels that encompass the city today have grown immensely since the Calamity. In the perpetual gloom of the subterranean chambers luminous crystals and brightkelp braziers grant enough light for businesses to thrive and citizens to build homes. That said, not all the inhabitants of Deven appreciate the light, as the disreputable Wraiths and other dwellers of darkness make up a large portion of the city’s population. It is best to keep looking over one’s shoulder lest a blade finds one’s heart.

nod6yfb3LdUhU69c603t.title: Acherus Quarry
nod6yfb3LdUhU69c603t.desc: This gigantic basin at the foot of Sergorod’s Blade is a testament to what several centuries of cruel slave labor is capable of: they moved a mountain’s worth of rock and dirt to reach the precious obsidian underneath. Yet at length the black blood of the earth ran dry and only small amounts are mined these days. And so the quarry under the grim, dark cliffs and the overcast skies now looks even more desolate.

nod7m5j3LdUkZ69c600B.title: Velarias
nod7m5j3LdUkZ69c600B.desc: Inky shadows and dark designs rule the tunnels below the sun-scorched, rocky hills that hide the township of Velarias. Even though no sane soul trusts the furtive Wraiths who reside here in great numbers and the region is completely barren, vagabonds, scoundrels, and smugglers frequent the town often enough to make these caverns a popular stop for comitati of the shadier variety.

nod8iJC3P6aBzd31f00M.title: Deserted Cove
nod8iJC3P6aBzd31f00M.desc: An old, abandoned, collapsed pier reaching into the muddy waters beyond the fog-covered shore; a decrepit hovel half-sunk into the bog; a swamp abuzz with a myriad of blood-sucking insects. What could possibly make someone come to this forsaken place?

nodBgtW3Pa1vXd31f00i.title: Carravhon, the Howling City
nodBgtW3Pa1vXd31f00i.desc: At the heart of a vast, jagged plain where the winds have gone mad sits forsaken Carravhon, hidden from mortal and immortal eyes alike, enveloped in a perpetual whirlwind of mind-scorching rage. Its moans and screams echo in the wasteland, stirring up horrors and carrying nightmares. Could you be the first in centuries to look upon the pristine white walls and golden domes of its slender, accursed towers?

nodbyNH3LeUnG69c600U.title: Tor'Zag's Shelter
nodbyNH3LeUnG69c600U.desc: Though the vast caverns and tunnels inside Blackblood Mountain merely gave refuge to Warleader Tor’Zag many centuries past, the Imperial city of Tenebvitris - or as people have been persistently calling it: Tor’Zag’s Shelter - that sprung up there following the war managed to transform into one of the most important settlements on the continent. Often referred to as ‘Sergorod’s City’, the Shelter not only houses the Cathedral of the Raging One in its immense, everdark caves but is also a bustling trading settlement and the center of obsidian harvesting in the region. Thousands toil and haggle under its wrought iron chandeliers every day while servants of the Master of Curses deal out justice in the name of their malevolent God.

nodc34x3L9Z71d31f00U.title: Vitrar
nodc34x3L9Z71d31f00U.desc: Hidden among the endless sand dunes of the deep desert is the sacred, lush oasis of the Sadirar water worshippers: Vitrar. The clear pools and streams running through primitive aqueducts are kept blessed by the blue-clad shamans and are guarded fiercely by the warriors of the tribe. Yet no soul would ever dream of befouling the waters of Vitrar - the oasis is simply too valuable for all travelers of the Searing Plains.

nodCERF3LdUZu69c602w.title: Lumen
nodCERF3LdUZu69c602w.desc: Those persistent enough to travel towards the blinding light and scorching heat of the South Calerus eventually reach the town of Lumen and glimpse its sandstone buildings protected by its shielding wall; yet most of the settlement was built under the sands, sheltered from the lethal temperatures and unbearable shine of the surface. At night, brigades of prospectors flood the still-searing crystal forest to get their hands on as rich a bounty as they can, hauling it back to Lumen’s bustling underground markets. Apart from Imperial crystal harvesting, the town is famous for its resident Crystalmancers, ever delving into the secrets of the calerus.

nodcG4Z3LetTu69c600E.title: The Forsaken Colony
nodcG4Z3LetTu69c600E.desc: The failure of industrious entrepreneurism made manifest, the Forsaken Colony is tucked away in a valley of mines among a cluster of barely traversable, jagged hills. Ever since House Cavadius abandoned their venture here, the bleak ruins have stood silently in this lonely wasteland.

nodctN23LetQM69c6006.title: Kotrar
nodctN23LetQM69c6006.desc: The tribe that dwells in Kotrar does not seem to mind the never ending windstorm that keeps beating on sandstone and people alike here. And why should they? The Great Wind Spirit has blessed this place like no other and they, its followers, are a persistent people. It is said that among the many white windmills and whistling totems, the gales whisper truths from distant places, and so the Kotrar know every visitor’s heart before they set foot in their village.

nodCSu83LdUmS69c600J.title: The Crimson Gate
nodCSu83LdUmS69c600J.desc: Standing in the long shadow of the massive, crimson fortress that guards the southwestern passage into the Dragonlands makes one feel tiny and insignificant. Drake riders circle in the sky while soldiers clad in red Dragonsteel patrol the gigantic stairway that travelers must ascend to be able to petition the Dragonlords. The tremendous might and majesty of the Dragonlands is perhaps nowhere as apparent as it is beneath the Crimson Gate.

nodDg5s3LetoE69c600T.title: Temple of the Sleepers
nodDg5s3LetoE69c600T.desc: Incredibly ancient and irreversibly cursed, this cyclopean temple of the Varotians have watched over the valley in silence for millennia. The stone face is carved with incredibly intricate designs depicting the history of a people who themselves are now only history. Yet its true secrets remain locked inside, unknowable and unseen until someone brave - or foolish - enough breaks the seals and enters the darkness. Until then, the Temple sleeps, just like the valley and the extinct people interred there.

nodFoMB3LxA7Jd31f00D.title: Crystal
nodFoMB3LxA7Jd31f00D.desc: It is no wonder that a town called ‘Crystal’ was named after the abundantly available resource right beyond its confines - a calerus of yellow, shoddy material that is as lethal during the day as any other crystal forest in the region. The settlement itself is still a budding venture, with rival Trading Houses vying for power and profit over the area, perhaps ignorant to the fact that the blinding and searing calerus is a less promising and more troublesome than they had envisioned.

nodGmEQ3LdW2369c602L.title: Ventulium
nodGmEQ3LdW2369c602L.desc: Eerie, high-pitched music floats across the jagged plains and draws travelers towards a rock shelf where a grand spire stands so tall that it seems to pierce the clouds. The intricately carved stone plays strange melodies ceaselessly under the hot gaze of the cruel sun. If Ventulium is the instrument, the constant wind is the musician; though one can only guess who the composer might be.

nodGpHP3LdUZ669c602Z.title: Crossroads
nodGpHP3LdUZ669c602Z.desc: Three large marble obelisks stand silently where the Emperor’s Road and the Windway meet. Sometimes comitati stop here before continuing their arduous journeys north, south, or east. The standing stones care little for such visitors for they have witnessed so many of their short-lived kind pass by. The whistling of the wind and the swirling dust never ceases here.

nodGTDi3LNiYK84d8005.title: Ash
nodGTDi3LNiYK84d8005.desc: Choked by the grey silt constantly floating over the colorless plains that wandered into the northwestern Jagged Waste, Ash is a perilous, depressing town that is barely under Imperial jurisdiction. Slavers and bounty hunters flocked here and turned the place into a frequented market that deals in servitude and suffering. Those found unwanted are sent into the pits to die. More grist for the mill, as they say.

nodHBJJ3LdXKK69c600y.title: Larnak
nodHBJJ3LdXKK69c600y.desc: It is hard to believe that life can thrive anywhere in the scorching, sandy deserts of the Searing Plains until one sees Larnak. Occupying cyclopean caves carved by water from rock, the city is covered in perpetual gloom only broken by the spear-like shafts of sunlight stabbing down through the large holes in the cave roof. The light caresses the surface of the vast underground lakes during the day, and this climate gave rise to the eerily luminescent brightkelp plantations that elevated the city to be the region’s largest and wealthiest. Strange people were drawn to this place to form a peculiar frontier society, including Sadirar nomads coming here to worship the Water Spirit and even the alien Yskorri whose hive hangs precariously over Larnak.

nodHQiK3LdUaX69c603E.title: Ioscian Quarry
nodHQiK3LdUaX69c603E.desc: What does one do when their quarry runs out of ore but is situated on the border of the Plains of Bone? Evidently, one turns it into a scavenging outpost for bone and ivory. Under the faded banners of the industrious House Oquo, an army of slaves and exploited free agents swarm out each day to risk life and limb against bone storms and marauding mutants to be able to haul back a worthy bounty from the macabre wasteland to the south. Grave robbing has never been so profitable.

nodHYo83LdW7g69c602o.title: Auguros Work Camp
nodHYo83LdW7g69c602o.desc: The stench of sweat and excrement hangs heavy in the air among the thousands of hovels that make up the Auguros Work Camp. Half-starved and thoroughly-beaten convicts eye passers-by cautiously. The thought of escape is strange to these sad inhabitants, as the lands beyond the many fences and walls here are so desolate that death is sure to find those insane enough to run, and so the camp has become a tyrannical testament to the notion that the suffering of some is the foundation of the profits of others.

nodhYqB3MJ8zed31f09g.title: Kernak Waystation
nodhYqB3MJ8zed31f09g.desc: Sheltered in an arid basin, surrounded by stone walls, and guarded by grim mercenaries, Kernak station provides all the illusion of safety most travelers crave. Yet a quick glance at the many signs of past destruction tells a tale of raiders, rock-storms or worse. Despite rebuilding time and again, it is not long before the Jagged Waste claims this place for good.

nodJ4WD3L9Yyud31f00P.title: Utvorar
nodJ4WD3L9Yyud31f00P.desc: Home to the eponymous Utvorar tribe of fire worshippers, this village is one of the few permanent settlements the Sadirar folk have. Poised on the edge of a large, barren plateau, protected from the raging heat of nearby lava lakes, rows of soot-covered sandstone houses and tents await visitors. Everything is painted orange and red - the holy colors of the Great Fire Spirit: clothes, awnings, banners, and even faces.

nodKrEr3LdUk869c6006.title: Arken
nodKrEr3LdUk869c6006.desc: Nestled beneath the thicket of rock pillars called the Arkoros Forest, the Imperial town of Arken is constantly beaten by wind and engulfed in fine dust from the Jagged Waste. However unforgivable though its surroundings are, the settlement’s inhabitants thrive thanks to the earth’s abundant bounty: marble, limestone, granite, and shale. Artists and artisans carve the precious stones in their workshops and warehouses ceaselessly behind the town’s silt-laden walls, under the watchful eyes of the Praetor.

nodLDSe3LdUmg69c600W.title: Salum
nodLDSe3LdUmg69c600W.desc: Beaten incessantly by the scorching rays of the cruel sun, quiet Salum is sitting at the southernmost point of desolate Brine Mere, a once beautiful inner sea. Its clusters of sandstone buildings are home to a handful of factions from the nearby Dragonlands, and the terraces beyond the town are fabled to be rich in salt beyond compare and yet the region’s masters have been reluctant to tap into that magnificent wealth. Colourful awnings provide shade and beneath them, deals for the coveted white powder are struck with great fervor. Beyond the low walls, the blindingly white flats stretch to the northern horizon - a promise of a bright future for some, the looming threat of an agonizing death to others.

nodMUso3LdXC569c600E.title: The Lost City of Vratluk
nodMUso3LdXC569c600E.desc: What fate befell ancient Vratluk? Historians only seem to agree on one thing: the great city was destroyed long before the Calamity and even at the height of their power, Imperials kept a safe distance from its crumbling ziggurats and collapsed walls. Now half-sunk into the desert, Vratluk still clings onto a pointless existence even if barely. Could it be that you are among the first souls to lay eyes upon its ruins in centuries?

nodn5T73LeQSb69c602V.title: Leviathan's Demise
nodn5T73LeQSb69c602V.desc: Legends speak of the cyclopean, vaguely Draconic beast’s remains that lie at the heart of the grim Plains of Bone, untouched by time and undisturbed by scavengers. Yet seeing the mountain-sized skeleton with one’s own eyes is awe and fear inspiring beyond what is imaginable. The Gods were right to strike down such a creature, for its wings would send hurricanes across the land and its steps would summon earthquakes. Perhaps they were jealous of such might.

nodNFmk3LdWDB69c603q.title: Fort Refugis
nodNFmk3LdWDB69c603q.desc: Forlorn and forgotten, the ruins of the old Imperial fortress that was meant to turn the tide of war against Dragmolac now stands as a monument to the might of the Black Brood instead. Whispers keep spreading about a haven for scum and villainy hiding among the broken walls and shattered towers. Here, at the end of the world, who would notice?

nodnT6t3LdWDz69c6046.title: Sadirar
nodnT6t3LdWDz69c6046.desc: Saddling the feet of the hallowed Mountain of Kor, the most sacred place of the Sadirar people, this village is the closest to a capital for these desert-dwelling nomads. Few are awarded the right to address or even see the council of shamans that governs all the tribes from this remote, desolate place and not many travelers come here to trade or negotiate in the first place. And yet the village named Sadirar thrives. If it is indeed due to the blessings of the Great Spirits or merely to the toiling of religious zealots is difficult to say.

nodpYcc3L9ZcGd31f043.title: Omphalat Outpost
nodpYcc3L9ZcGd31f043.desc: Life can thrive even beneath such an arid and dead wasteland as the Smolderbone Flats. The outpost called Omphalat, nestled in humid caverns below the surface, is proof of this. Mushrooms forests spread in the gloom, tended to by bound hands.

nodqzor3LetTw69c600F.title: The Forlorn Hive
nodqzor3LetTw69c600F.desc: Ever since the Yrgs that dug the maze-like tunnels among these bleak rocks disappeared, every sane soul has avoided this spot. What kind of a place is so forlorn that even these overgrown insects would abandon it?

nodr5833LdUVX69c600j.title: Sun Rock
nodr5833LdUVX69c600j.desc: It is said that even a single hero can make a difference. In the case of Sun Rock, this certainly seems true. The mythical warrior Lavendius defeated a terrible monster and founded the town all by himself, entering the hall of Imperial saints in the process. Locals here worship his image and deeds with amazing fervor, not perturbed at all that Lavendius may never have existed. The dome-shaped rock shell protecting Sun Rock keeps the scars of the ancient Wyrms as a grim reminder that the wasteland is never truly conquered. Under it, a busy maze of cool caverns and large halls awaits weary travelers.

nodrPu63L9Yxcd31f00A.title: Avernum
nodrPu63L9Yxcd31f00A.desc: On the tip of the Molten Tongue, guarding the arid Smolderbone Flats, lies the Imperial city of Avernum behind its sun-scorched walls of bone and dark stone. The many forges and furnaces here toil relentlessly, belching foul smoke day and night under the watchful gaze of the Prefectus, who commands his black-hearted Avernus Legion from the imposing Slagfort. Many comitati, merchants, and grifters flock to Avernum in the hopes of finding trade, rest or work; often, only cruelty and dark deals await them in this corrupt city under burning skies.

nodRxqE3Pa1v5d31f00W.title: Tectum Kelvar
nodRxqE3Pa1v5d31f00W.desc: What foul grave is this, upturned and broken apart, its accursed contents spilt across the wasteland? Surely, its gaping maw is found exactly where the forgotten vault of Kelvar should be but can they be one and the same? One would have to delve into the great crag and the skittering darkness below to find out.

nodSJVB3LdXBm69c600A.title: The Sunken Tower
nodSJVB3LdXBm69c600A.desc: At the heart of the deepest, most inhospitable desert of terra supra the Sunken Tower has stood for over a millennium, unmarred by time and surrounded by nothing but sand. A relic of the ancient world barely clinging to the surface, this accursed place is nigh-impossible to reach. Yet its twisting innards promise perilous secrets, and so fools brave the darkness below from time to time.

nodTabf3LetVD69c600K.title: Mirage
nodTabf3LetVD69c600K.desc: Fruit ripens in the orchards of the inhabited oasis under the scorching gaze of the desert sun, irrigated by the blood of the fallen who - in the name of their Trading House - fight a war for the rights to Mirage’s bounties. Such a battle can never have a clear victor however - a truth that escapes the countless Venari, Oquo, and Darius agents who throw away their lives in the conflict like so many mindless drones. The sun watches indifferently while the carrion birds grow fat around Mirage.

noduRsu3LdWDT69c603v.title: Eitrar
noduRsu3LdWDT69c603v.desc: Hard stone and luminous crystals constitute this remote village that lies in the shadow of the great mountains of the west. Its inhabitants, the Eitrar tribe worship the Great Earth Spirit and so they interpret the rumbling of the ground that is so common this close to the once great Dwarven kingdom as the voice of their deity. Indeed, the exquisite bounties of the earth that the people so casually gather here seem to indicate that some sort of a divine will is at work.

nodv4XU3LdUWE69c600u.title: The Spires
nodv4XU3LdUWE69c600u.desc: Ancient, unknowable, impossibly tall, impervious to damage, and so black they seem to swallow the light, the Spires have watched silently over the wasteland around Deven for a millennium. What was their purpose and who created them? It is unlikely that mortals of this Age will ever know.

nodv98f3LdUf569c603s.title: Vigilus Tower
nodv98f3LdUf569c603s.desc: A tower of dark rock guards the great valley between the imposing Blackblood Mountains and Sergorod’s Blade, ever vigilant, ever menacing under ashen skies, garrisoning the Empire’s finest and bravest. Yet duty at such a remote and desolate place can grind away watchfulness and boredom has been known to turn the most loyal of warriors into marauders. Vigilus, however, has a grand reputation to uphold.

nodyupY3LdUbC69c603T.title: The Twin Towers
nodyupY3LdUbC69c603T.desc: Standing on either side of the only traversable pass across the barren Sepis Mountains like a pair of ancient, weather-beaten guardsmen, the Twin Towers are said to be the gateway between the Imperial hearthlands and the ‘lands beyond’. Yet they appear merely as two decrepit fortresses, huddled beneath walls of rock, one abandoned, the other guarded by a grim legion - and thus the gateway becomes a barrier.

recoDT32lY2mX6cR5.title: Иметь по меньшей мере 1 ездового или вьючного зверя
